pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"The only F2P Stun character available and the go-to choice for team building for those without S-Rank options.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Can combo together her EX and Charged Basic Attacks to create high Daze combos allowing for fast and effective Stuns.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Anby’s Dodge Counters grant her a good chunk of additional energy allowing her to access her EX’s faster than many other characters when played as a main fielder. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Using Anby’s EX at specific times throughout her combo allows her to increase its speed significantly, speeding her overall Stunning rotation.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

cons.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Optimal Stun combo requires a combination of Tap and Hold inputs making her a little more challenging than other characters to play.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Deals noticeably less Stun than her S-Rank counterparts.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Lack of outstanding features outside of her reasonable Daze and Electric-type, which makes her susceptible to power creep. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

build.substats: CRIT RATE = CRIT DMG > ATK% > PEN = ATK

talents.name: Rapid Charge Mode
talents.desc: When the 4th-hit of Anby's Basic Attack hits an enemy, her Energy Generation Rate is increased by 12% for 30s.

talents.name: Precision Discharge
talents.desc: When Basic Attack: Thunderbolt hits a Stunned enemy, its DMG is increased by 30%. When Anby's EX Special Attack hits an enemy that is not Stunned, the Daze inflicted is increased by 10%.

talents.name: Well-Disciplined
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Conducting Charge
talents.desc: When Anby launches a Chain Attack or uses her Ultimate, off-field Electric Agents recover 3 Energy. For every 12% Energy Generation Anby Has, recover an additional 2 Energy, up to a maximum of 6.

talents.name: Street Experience
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Charging Field
talents.desc: When Anby uses her EX Special Attack, she gains 8 stacks of Charge (max 8 stacks). When she hits an enemy with her Basic Attack or Dash Attack, 1 stack of Charge is consumed, increasing that attack's DMG by 45%.

introduction.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"A mysterious young girl who never talks about her past, almost as if she didn't have one. She is calm and collected, and unusually competent and efficient in combat, almost as if she'd had years of training. In an unexpected incident, Nicole brought her back to the Cunning Hares, and she has an emotional independence on her ever since. She loves watching movies, but due to certain lack of common sense she seems to almost think them real-life stories.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has the unique mechanic to retrigger Shocks every 0.5 seconds after dealing 4 Critical Hits while in Burst mode giving him one of the highest potential kits for an A-rank unit.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Part of one of the top teams (Shock team) as of 1.0 making him one of the only non-support A-Ranks to find a spot in the most competitive compositions.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has great Mindscapes, giving him good scaling potential as you develop your account. His M1 prolongs his Burst Mode duration by a good amount, and his M4 gives the whole team a Crit Rate buff after he uses a Chain or Ultimate attack for 12 seconds.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Is a Bro.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

cons.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has a large amount of his potential damage within his kit tied to his ability to trigger additional damage against Shocked enemies, making him reliant on ensuring enemies remain Shocked as much as possible and for as large amount of damage as possible.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has limited options outside of S-rank’s when it comes to team building.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Relies heavily on being in Burst Mode to deal the majority of his damage and feels lackluster outside of it, making Anton one of the most energy-reliant characters in the game.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

build.substats: CRIT RATE = CRIT DMG > ATK% > PEN = ATK

talents.name: Warm-up Exercises
talents.desc: When Drill Attack hits an enemy, Anton gains additional Energy up to a maximum of 5 Energy per skill use.

talents.name: State of Flow
talents.desc: When Anton uses his EX Special Attack and enters Burst Mode, he gains a Shield that equals to 7.5% of his max HP. While in Burst Mode, entering combat or switching in reapplies the Shield effect. This effect can trigger once every 15s. The Shield dissipates when Burst Mode ends.

talents.name: Rotational Training
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Everyone Get Fired Up!
talents.desc: When Anton uses a Chain Attack or Ultimate, all squad members' CRIT Rate increases by 10% for 12s.

talents.name: Jack of All Trades
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Break the Limit
talents.desc: When Anton's Piledriver Attack triggers a critical hit, his Basic Attack: Enthusiastic Drills (Burst Mode) and Dodge Counter: Overload Drill (Burst Mode) deal 4% more DMG for 30s, stacking up to 6 times. Repeated triggers reset the duration.

introduction.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Leads Others in His Passion for Work. A senior staff member of Belobog Industries, he's an onsite project manager who's always ready to go. Energetic and Reliable. He's full of vigor and always rises to the occasion. Kind-Hearted Despite Appearances. With a sharp tongue but a soft heart, he can't say \"no\" to those in need. Strong, Sincere & Straightforward. Open and honest, nothing can seem to upset him.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

review.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Astra Yao is a S-Rank Ranged Ether Support Agent wielding a microphone and the power of her voice to buff allies and deal a bit of damage herself. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"As the first Limited Support unit, it’s no surprise that Astra’s buffs take things to the next level and set a new bar for team-wide boosts. With that said she is more than just a buff machine as she brings her own unique playstyle to the game, thanks to her powerful but somewhat unusual kit. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Astra is all about her Special Attack, an ability that renders her immobile and mostly inactive by placing her in a special singing state called “Idyllic Cadenza”. In this state, she remains on the field even when swapped off  (is invulnerable for the duration), buffs allies, and allows them to expend her energy to trigger Quick Assists on demand taking the concept of “Quick-Swap” to an entirely new level. If all of that sounds a bit strange and maybe a bit too simple you’d be right so let's get into more detail.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her kit is wordy and doesn’t read like a traditional character’s kit due to the nature of her “Idyllic Cadenza” state, but have no fear! ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"She is in fact the simplest character to play in the entire game (and it’s not close), with her gameplay boiling down to the following:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Use her Special Attack to enter the “Idyllic Cadenza” state.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Use her Chain Attack when available.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Use her Ultimate when it makes sense.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"And that’s it... There is no “traditional rotation” with her and whilst there are other actions you can perform such as Basic Attacks and Dodges, it’s usually not needed. With that said, while “How to Play” Astra is simple, understanding what she’s doing and her effects on teams is less so, and quite important to making full of her. And as such, it’s time to dive into the nitty gritty of her kit!","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her unique resource gauge is “Chords” which unlike other character’s resources doesn’t require you to do anything special to accumulate. “Chords” are simply a representation of her current energy for the purpose of tracking her potential ability usage more easily. For every 25 energy she has,  it will show up as having 1 “Chord”, thus 100 energy = 4 “Chords”. Spending 25 of that on an ability will consume 1 “Chord” worth of energy.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"First and most important of Astra’s abilities is her Special Attack which notably has no EX-Special alternative and Astra will be using that energy for something else. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Using the Special Attack causes the following effects to happen all at once:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Astra enters the “Idyllic Cadenza” state.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Astra performs an attack called Tremolo.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"She can optionally choose to press and hold to charge the Special Attack. Doing so draws enemies toward Astra and increases the Tremeloes triggered from the typically 1 up to a maximum of 4 instead (dependent on charge duration).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"She triggers a Quick Assist in the same way as all other Support’s Special Attacks (Can be converted to a “Precise Assist”).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Tremolo is a special damage source triggered by multiple of Astra’s abilities, it deals a small amount of Ether DMG, but most importantly is considered EX-Special DMG which is important for the purpose of many W-Engine effects.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"While in the “Idyllic Cadenza” state Astra gains access to a myriad of buffs, mechanics and ability changes. To get started and keep things simple here is a quick list of all of them:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Becomes immobile outside of Dashing.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Gains Anti-Interrupt Level and takes 40% reduced damage while on field.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Gains the ability to remain on the field in an Invulnerable state when switched out maintaining “Idyllic Cadenza” while not being the active Agent.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Grants all squad members 20% DMG and 25% CRIT DMG.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Enables Squad Members to trigger “Precise Assists” and gain access to Quick Assists at non-standard times.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Out of all of these, the last one is the one that needs explaining. While in “Idyllic Cadenza” state and having at least 1 “Chord”, whenever the on-field agent executes:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"A hit on an enemy (CD: 3s).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"A Heavy Attack on an enemy (CD: 1s).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"She will grant that Agent a Quick Assist between them and your team's other Agent (not being Astra) immediately followed by a “Precise Assist” trigger and the “Chord” consumption related to it. Triggering Quick Assists in this way, follow the cooldowns listed above for their respective attack types.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"“Precise Assists” trigger whenever any squad mate performs a:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Quick Assist","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Chain Attack","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Defensive Assist","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Evasive Assist","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"And Astra has access to a “Chord” (25 energy). Triggering a “Precise Assist\" consumes the “Chord” and causes Astra to launch 1 Tremolo (the same one as the initial cast of her Special Attack) followed immediately by 3 “Tone Clusters” which deal a small amount of Ether DMG each for even more damage.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Astra can remain in the “Idyllic Cadenza” state indefinitely even if her energy reaches 0 - a fact that many players take advantage of by using her ability at the start of battle and only ever switching back to her to use her Ultimate or Chain Attack.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Astra’s Additional Ability and Core Passive directly build on her Special Attack and “Idyllic Cadenza” state enhancing it further. Her Core Passive: “Graceful Andante” allows her to grant 35% of her own ATK as additional Flat ATK to both herself and any character that switches in after triggering a “Precise Assist” up to a cap of 1200 Flat ATK (Requires roughly 3430 ATK to max out at M0). Assuming you’re playing Astra normally and constantly alternating between your other two agents via Quick Assists you’ll have no issues maintaining this buff on your entire team indefinitely.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Whereas, while Active, her Additional Ability: “Moonlit Frenzy” causes her Tremolo and 3 Tone Clusters to double trigger every time a “Chord” is consumed, doubling her damage output from “Precise Assist” triggers.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Astra’s Chain Attack is a stock standard Ether DMG attack but her Ultimate is something special. Upon use, her Ultimate heals all squad members up to 2950 HP and causes the next two Quick Assists Astra grants to be Chain Attacks instead. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"With this Astra is ZZZ’s very first Healer and can also open up new potential combos with characters having particularly impactful Chain Attacks.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Because her role in battle is to remain in the “Idyllic Cadenza” state, off the field for almost all of the combat, it should be no surprise that her Basic Attacks, Dodge Attacks, and Assists aren’t of too much relevance or used that frequently. With that said her Dodge can be used to reposition if you end up with her as your active Agent and her Basic Attack can be pressed and held to perform an attack that causes her to exit the “Idyllic Cadenza” state. Some of her abilities in these categories also gain different versions while within “Idyllic Cadenza” state but aren’t impactful on her role as a Support and as a result aren’t frequently used.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"In conclusion, Astra is perhaps one of the simplest characters to play in the game but also is someone who has some of the highest impact on teams she's present in.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" Astra teams are effectively 2 Agent teams as Astra is almost exclusively off-field buffing and offering her Quick Assists. While this playstyle is competitive it certainly won't be for everyone. It also heavily relies on the fact that those 2 Agents are strong enough to carry the extra weight. Ultimately, Astra has some of the best buffs in the game, offers a new twist on combat and team building and is a top tier meta choice at the time of her release.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Universal support that can be played in almost any team composition.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Buffs affect the whole team, offering even greater power to double DPS teams than other supports.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Provides healing to teammates which is useful for content where sustain is relevant.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Allows incredibly frequent use of Quick Assissts and the use of Chain attack outside of stun windows.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Provides an incredible array of buffs, including one of the highest ATK buffs in the game.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Not reliant on her Signature W-Engine to perform well.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

cons.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Effectively locks you into a 2 active Agent playstyle, due to her low field time playstyle - while competitive, it won't be for everyone.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"As a part of the new \"Stars of Lyra\", no current DPS characters share her faction which can make building teams with older characters awkward.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

endgameStats.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"ATK: ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"3430+","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Astra requires at minimum ~3430 ATK to get the maximum effect out of her Core Skill team-wide buff.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Because of the potency of this buff, reaching this ATK breakpoint is the most important thing Astra can do with her Set Bonus, Main Stats, Sub Stats, and W-Engine choice. Use each of these methods to stack ATK until you have enough.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"HP: ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"10500+","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"DEF: ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"800+","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Energy Regen: ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"0 - 130%","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" (Dependant on Secondary Disc Set, Disc Main Stat and W-Engine)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Gaining more ER is equivalent to gaining more free Quick Assists. Because of this getting as much Energy Regen as possible is very beneficial and picking it up whenever it doesn't interfere with you reaching 3430 ATK or more is a top priority.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"After achieving or exceeding all the stat goals above, you can aim to maximize Astra's damage potential by either stacking CRIT or Anomaly (","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"not both","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":") - any amount of either of the offensive stats is beneficial.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"CRIT RATE: Any Amount","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"CRIT DMG: Any Amount","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"OR","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Anomaly Proficiency: Any Amount","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

build.substats: CRIT [ATK% > Flat ATK (Top Priorities Until Ability Cap) > CRIT RATE = CRIT DMG  > PEN] or ANOMALY [ATK% > Flat ATK (Top Priorities Until Ability Cap) > Anomaly Proficiency  > PEN]

talents.name: 12-Tone Equal Temperament
talents.desc: When Astra Yao's attack hits an enemy, the target's All-Attribute RES is reduced by 6%, stacking up to 3 times and lasting 30s. Repeated triggers refresh the duration. Upon entering the battlefield, Astra Yao immediately gains 1,000 Decibels. When activating her Ultimate, all squad members gain 1 stack of Song of Protection for 60s. When attacked by an enemy, consume Song of Protection, granting Invulnerability for 1s.

talents.name: Art of Greed
talents.desc: The ATK buff from Core Passive: Graceful Andante is further increased by 19%, with an increased maximum of 400. While in the Idyllic Cadenza state, when other characters switch in through a Quick Assist, Chain Attack, Defensive Assist, or Evasive Assist, Astra Yao will additionally follow up with 1 Tremolo and 3 Tone Clusters to attack. This effect can trigger once every 3s.

talents.name: Interwoven Staff Notation
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Hair Upon Your Nape
talents.desc: After activating a Chain Attack or Ultimate, within 15s, Astra Yao can trigger a Quick Assist even if she does not have Chords. When the attack hits an enemy, the interval for triggering a Quick Assist is reduced to 1s. While in the Idyllic Cadenza state, when other characters enter the field via a Quick Assist, they will receive different buffs based on their specialty, and this effect can be triggered once every 3s for the entire squad: Attack: The next Quick Assist heavy attack on an enemy will deal extra DMG equal to 300% of Astra Yao's ATK; Anomaly: The next Quick Assist will have 50% increased Anomaly Buildup; Stun: The next Quick Assist will inflict 50% increased Daze.

talents.name: Proxy and Silk String
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: We Are the World
talents.desc: While in the Idyllic Cadenza state, the DMG multiplier for Tremolo and Tone Clusters released or followed up with will increase to 200% of the original, and CRIT Rate is increased by 80%. When triggering a Precise Assist, Astra Yao will automatically follow up with the charged 3rd-hit of Basic Attack: Capriccio, with a 80% increased CRIT Rate. This effect can trigger once every 10s.

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Applies a sizable team-wide Shield when executing his EX combo - something that isn’t necessary in endgame but can be nice to have and allows you to make a few mistakes.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"The only Defensive character suitable for being played as a Stunning character making him valuable to F2P players without other options.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Grants all other Fire and Belobog agents 16% Crit Rate while Shielding them, allowing him to stand out from other Stun and Defense-based characters.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"When paired with Koleda will modify and significantly improve her Ultimate and Enhanced Basic Attacks.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

introduction.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"A handsome cyborg with a casual and carefree personality. review.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Burnice is a S-Rank Melee Fire Anomaly Agent who brings forth a unique playstyle of passively dealing a good part of her damage and Anomaly Buildup while being off-field. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Complimenting this, she doesn’t require much time on-field in first place, and to no surprise of anyone, being an Anomaly character she excels at applying and amplifying Burn Disorder quickly and consistently - making her a top choice for Anomaly/Disorder teams, especially ones with characters who can take up the field-time Burnice doesn’t really require. To understand exactly what makes this Pyromaniac cyclist work let's dive into her playstyle and kit! ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Her play style primarily focuses on marking enemies with her special “Scorch” status and building & utilizing her special resource “Heat” - ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"all the while taking minimal field time and using her most powerful abilities to apply massive amounts of Fire Anomaly. Enemies that are Scorched by Burnice suffer great damage and Anomaly when hit by any squad member other than Burnice. That's possible thanks to her Core Passive (that works even when she's off-field) at the cost of consuming her “Heat” count slightly. Continuously triggering Afterburn on Scorched targets is her game plan and in order to do the same she needs to build and maintain a good amount of “Heat” consistently. It can be achieved by either using her Ultimate or spending energy. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"This leads to a gameplay loop of Scorching the enemies, building and maintaining “Heat” with EX-Special/Ultimate, and going off-field. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Now with the basics covered let's get into the nitty gritty! ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Burnice’s Core Passive - Nitro-Fuel Cocktail is the source of her most important mechanics - “Heat” resource, “Scorch” status and Afterburn damage off-field. Let’s start with “Heat” first Burnice starts the battle with and can hold up to 100 “Heat” at a time. She gains 1.4 “Heat” per 1 energy spent and upon reaching 50 “Heat” enters the Nitro-Fuel Cocktail State which she will maintain until her “Heat” reaches 0. After which she’ll need to reach 50 again to re-enter.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"While in the Nitro-Fuel Cocktail State she gains access to a new Enhanced Basic Attack and is able to apply the “Scorch” status when hitting enemies with any of the following abilities: ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Mixed Flame Blend (Nitro-Fuel Cocktail Enhanced Basic Attack)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Any EX-Special Attack","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Chain Attack","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Ultimate","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"As mentioned earlier, whenever a Scorched enemy takes damage from a squad member other than Burnice, they suffer Afterburn taking up to 350% of Burnice’s ATK as Assist Attack","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":" ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"type damage immediately and a good chunk of Fire Anomaly buildup at the cost of 8 “Heat” per activation. Afterburn can only trigger once every 1.5 seconds and as soon as the Nitro-Fuel Cocktail state ends at 0 “Heat” all scorches will be removed immediately. As an added bonus for every 10 Anomaly Proficiency Burnice has, her Afterburn damage is boosted by 1% up to 30% (Requires 300 Anomaly Proficiency). ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Burnice’s standard Basic Attack is a multi-part combo consisting of 5 attacks with Physical and Fire hits mixed in. None of these hits deal much damage or interact with “Heat” resource, “Scorch” status, or Afterburn so aren’t usually used. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Bar this she gains access to the Special Charged Basic Attack: Mixed Flame Blend when in the Nitro-Fuel Cocktail State. Upon pressing and holding the Basic Attack button, she immediately consumes up to 20 “Heat” to perform a channeled spinning attack that applies “Scorch”, good Fire Anomaly, and deals reasonable damage. This ability is ideal for quick application of “Scorch” without any conditions or consumption of energy when you have maximum “Heat”, additionally while this ability consumes up to 20 “Heat” it is still useable with even 1 “Heat” as long as you’re still within the Nitro-Fuel Cocktail state.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Burnice’s Dash Attack and Dodge Counter, similar to her standard Basic Attacks, have no bearing on her “Heat” or “Scorch” mechanics so they aren’t used outside of niche scenarios where you need to avoid damage or close a gap.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Also in a similar vein is her Quick Assist and Assist Follow-Up. These attacks do reasonable damage and apply strong Anomaly for their field-time requirements but aren’t critical for her gameplay. As such if the opportunity to use them arises they’re worthwhile but not mandatory in any case.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Her Ultimate as we’ve covered earlier is an ability you should absolutely consider using whenever the team has the Decibels available and her “Heat” isn’t capped out","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":". It hits incredibly hard, deals a tremendous amount of Anomaly, and takes up very little field time for how effective it is - all thanks to the fact that halfway through casting it she triggers a Quick Assist for her teammates and can switch out while she continues casting it off-field. On top of all this, her Ultimate generates her 50 “Heat” allowing her to keep her Afterburn trigger continuously without being solely reliant on her energy if timed correctly. Her Chain attack is also worth using when available as long as no other team member requires their Chain Attack to function - it deals a decent chunk of damage, large amounts of Fire Anomaly build-up, and is relatively quick to use. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Finally let's talk about her Special and EX-Special attacks. As with most characters, Burnice’s standard Special Attack isn’t used. Although when it comes to her EX she has two of them - “Standard Shot” and “Double Shot” - both of them are channeled Flamethrower attacks that deal continuous damage, massive Fire Anomaly, consume energy over a short duration and deal an explosion at the end. The difference between the two is as follows:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" “Standard Shot” consumes a relatively small amount of energy over its duration, makes use of only one of her Flamethrowers, and allows her to reposition mid-channel by strafing left or right. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"“Double Shot” on the other hand consumes significantly more energy (over 2x), uses both of her Flamethrowers, deals more Anomaly and damage, lacks repositioning, and has an activation requirement.  ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"In most cases, it’s advisable to use “Double Shot” as it has a similar channel time to “Single Shot” but does significantly more damage and Anomaly application while also converting her energy into “Heat” at a faster pace. In order to access “Double Shot” when using the EX-Special instead of the standard “Single Shot” simply tap the EX twice in quick succession (which will cause it to swap from “Single” to “Double” after a short delay) or make use of the EX immediately after any of the following abilities to skip out on having to double tap the ability (Executes with no delay);","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Mixed Flame Blend","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Chain Attack: Fuel-Fed Flame","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Assist Follow-Up: Scorching Dew","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"As a final bonus, her Additional Ability grants her 65% additional Fire Anomaly Buildup to the following abilities;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Mixed Flame Blend","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Both EX Special Attacks “Single” and “Double”","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Afterburn","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"On top of this, it also extends all Burns inflicted by the squad by 3 seconds. It goes without saying this Additional Ability is worth activating and should always be a goal to consider when building a team for Burnice.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Now let’s bring it all together - when playing Burnice all you need to worry about is to keep your enemy consistently Scorched and maintain a healthy amount of “Heat” via timely Ultimate and EX-Special “Double Shot” use. Outside of this other abilities can be optionally used but focusing on granting your allies as much field time as possible while her Afterburn constantly triggers is generally her best play. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"As it should be clear by now that without “Heat”, she can’t make use of a very large part of her kit and to maintain it she either needs a steady supply of energy for EX’s or the use of her Ultimate. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"As such she is definitely one of the more energy-hungry characters - more so in long drawn-out fights. To remedy this somewhat ensure no “Heat” is wasted when using EX-Specials or Ultimates.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"In conclusion, ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Burnice serves as a top-tier Anomaly Sub-DPS option","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" especially when paired with characters who can make use of the field-time she frees up. If you’re looking to further invest into Anomaly, specifically Disorder, she's a great addition to any endgame roster. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"As a Sub-DPS who doesn't need to steal the field time from other characters, she can be easily slotted into various teams.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Incredible Fire Anomaly Application - ideal for Burn or Disorder-focused teams.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Can deal a significant portion of her damage and Anomaly application while off-field doubling down on her low field-time playstyle.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has surprisingly high direct damage multipliers for an Anomaly character giving her the option to gain extra damage through stats such as Critical Rate and Critical Damage if you find it on gear.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Easy To Play.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

build.substats: Anomaly Proficiency > ATK% > PEN = ATK

talents.name: Kindred Flames
talents.desc: Increases the limit of Heat from 100 to 140. Upon entering the battlefield, Burnice accumulates an additional 40 Heat. Increases the DMG Multiplier of the Afterburn effect by 100% of Burnice's ATK. Additionally, the accumulated Fire Anomaly Buildup from the Afterburn effect is increased by 25%.

talents.name: Extra at No Additional Charge
talents.desc: When triggering the Afterburn effect, Thermal Penetration is applied to the enemy, stacking up to 5 times and lasting 6s. Repeated triggers reset the duration. When any allied unit in the squad hits the enemy, the attack's PEN Ratio is increased by 4% for each stack of Thermal Penetration, up to a max of 20%.

talents.name: Optimistic by Nature
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Ultimate Fuel Supply
talents.desc: When an EX Special Attack or Assist Attack hits an enemy, the move's CRIT Rate increases by 30%. The max flame spray duration of EX Special Attack: Intense Heat Stirring Method - Double Shot is increased by 1s.

talents.name: Dance of Fire and Ice
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Burning Invitation
talents.desc: When Burnice hits an enemy with EX Special Attack: Intense Heat Stirring Method - Double Shot, it triggers an additional special Afterburn effect, dealing 60% of Burnice's ATK as Fire DMG to the target. This effect can trigger once every 0.5s and does not consume Heat. After hitting an enemy with EX Special Attack: Intense Heat Stirring Method - Double Shot, while the move is active, EX Special Attack: Intense Heat Stirring Method - Double Shot, special Afterburn effects, and Burn effects will ignore 25% of the target's Fire RES. When EX Special Attack: Intense Heat Stirring Method - Double Shot's fire blast hits an enemy, if that enemy is Burned, trigger an additional instance of Burn DMG equal to 1,800% of the original DMG. This effect can trigger once every 20s for each target.

She is responsible for all the fuel used by the machinery owned by the Sons of Calydon. She seems to have a passion for fuel that overwhelms all else. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

review.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Caesar is S-Rank Melee Physical Defense Agent, excelling at providing both offensive and defensive buffs, while inflicting Daze equivalent to Stun Agents.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" What sets her apart from others is her amazing Shield “Radiant Aegis” that for sure is the strongest support skill in the game (at the time of her release). ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"This combined with her Support and Stun skills makes her an incredible addition to various endgame compositions.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"The entirety of her kit revolves around the “Radiant Aegis” Shield, granted by her Core Passive - Barrier of Resilience. It allows “Radiant Aegis” to be gained by any of the following actions:","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"EX Special Attack: Parry Counter","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"EX Special Attack: Overpowered Shield Bash (When triggered via retaliation)","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Chain Attack: Road Rage Slam","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Ultimate: Savage Smash","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Once used, “Radiant Aegis” protects the entire team with a Shield equal to Caesar’s 1400% of Base Impact + 1400 (at maximum rank). ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"The shield boasts incredible uptime, has no re-application cooldown, and transfers to active character on the field without delay","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":", allowing you permanent access as long as you retrigger it as needed. “Radiant Aegis” is more than a Barrier - it increases Attack by 1000, and increases their Anti-Interrupt value for the duration of Shield + for additional 5 seconds after it breaks. Furthermore, no single instance of damage can exceed the Shield’s total value, granting protection from being one-shotted/massive hits. As such, the versatility and strength of this Shield makes it one of strongest buffs available, providing her team with a powerful mix of Survivability and Damage.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Her Additional Ability - Battle Spirit, requires at least one teammate who can perform a Defensive Assist or belongs to the same Faction to activate. ","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"Enhancing her Support capabilities, Caesar applies 25% Damage Increase debuff to enemies with a 7m radius lasting for 30 seconds, when hitting with any of the following abilities:","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Triggering a Retaliation via Ability use or Perfect Block (Special mechanics we’ll cover below)","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Defensive Assist: Aegis Shield","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Basic Attack: Dead End","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"We will analyze each of them soon, but the important part is that the debuff is easy to apply, lasts long and will always be active. ","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"The combination of these Abilities is the driving force behind her kit - with her goal in combat being keeping these buffs active while dishing out as much Daze as possible. To understand the optimal method, let us dive into her Active Abilities. ","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"She possesses two different Basic Attacks. Her 6 Part Attack Combo has low damage and Daze multipliers, limiting its usage. On the other hand, her held Basic Attack - Dead End is much more impactful - it requires an Assist Point to perform and launches Shields in all directions, pulling enemies closer, granting her Temporary Invulnerability.","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" Most importantly it applies her Additional Ability - Battle Spirit, without relying on enemies attacking her.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" This Basic Attack is not part of her main game plan but can be a powerful asset to trigger her Additional Ability in a pinch when the enemy isn’t attacking you. ","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Her Special Attack and EX Special Attack feature two variants each, sharing somewhat similar mechanics. With her Special Attack being more situational in use, we will be focusing on her EX Special Attack in this guide, as its primary focus of most of her combos .","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"The two types of her EX are as follows:","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"EX Special Attack: Parry Counter (1st EX)","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"EX Special Attack: Overpowered Shield Bash (2nd EX)","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"EX Special Attack - Parry Counter is Forward Shield Slam dealing Physical Damage and strong Daze, costing 40 Energy. Her second EX Special Attack - Overpowered Shield Bash deals even stronger damage and Daze at half the cost (20 Energy), but you need to:","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Launch her EX Special Attack: Parry Counter (1st EX) first.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Gain Retaliation via an Ability or a Perfect Block.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"The first condition is easy and allows you to use two EX’s back to back forming one of Caesar’s more effective combos:","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"EX Special Attack: Parry Counter (1st EX)","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"EX Special Attack: Overpowered Shield Bash (2nd EX)","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"The second condition “Retaliation” is a special state granted to Caesar after using some of her Abilities or by executing a “Perfect Block”. Perfect Block is a special mechanic associated exclusively with the following abilities:","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"EX Special Attack: Parry Counter (1st EX)","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"EX Special Attack: Overpowered Shield Bash (2nd EX)","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Special Attack: Shockwave Shield Bash","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"When using any of these abilities while an enemy is attacking her, she will instead perform a “Perfect Block” empowered version of the ability, gaining Immunity from attack and staggering the enemy. Of course, she can immediately execute her 2nd EX Special Attack right after.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Using her 1st EX Special Attack grants her access to 2nd EX Special Attack already, so when performing a Perfect Block with 1st EX, it instead reduces the subsequent 2nd EX Special Attack energy cost from 20 to 0. Meanwhile, performing Perfect Block with her 2nd EX Special Attack refunds the 20 energy used to cast it, without allowing her to trigger it again. ","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Her EX’s are indeed a bit confusing so just remember, if possible, to use her EX to interrupt enemy attacks to gain some additional benefits and whenever gaining Retaliation, ensure you make a quick use of her 2nd EX Special Attack. ","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Her Dodge Abilities are decent, but are a little more specific in usage and aren't regularly used as other characters.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" When an enemy attacks it’s generally preferred to trigger a Defensive Assist or go for a Perfect Block with her Special Ability over a Dodge or Dash Attack. With that said, her Dodge Counter deals good Daze to enemies and her Dash Attack, if timed perfectly, can allow her access to Retaliation without the bonus of a Perfect Block.  ","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Her Quick Assist is simple and won’t be utilized often. ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"But the combo of her Defensive Assist and Assist Follow-Up is incredibly strong and integral to her gameplay.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" Her Defensive Assist parries attack, similar to most characters and applies her Additional Ability debuff, but the Assist Follow Up you can execute right after is particularly amazing. Using it causes reasonable damage, strong Daze and allows Caesar to immediately enter Retaliation and follow-up with her 2nd EX Special Attack - Overpowered Shield Bash. The combination of these 3 abilities form the Core of her kit as executing them mitigates an enemy attack, deal strong Daze, activate/refresh her Core Passive Shield, grant an Attack Boost and apply her Damage Taken Increase debuff to all enemies in minimal field time at and cheap cost of 1 Assist Point and 20 Energy. To Sum it up: ","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Caesar Core Combo:","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Defensive Assist: Aegis Shield (Activates Additional Ability: Battle Spirit)","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Assist Follow-Up: Aiding Blade (Gain Retaliation)","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"EX Special Attack: Overpowered Shield Bash (Activates Core Ability: Radiant Aegis)","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"This specific combo lets Caesar inflict Daze per second equivalent to some of the strongest Stun Type Agents in the game","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":", allowing her to substitute for that role while bringing a multitude of supportive capabilities. This combo achieves most of what Caesar aims to provide and keeping her off field, barring taking her out to trigger Defensive Assists or dump excess Energy is a completely viable and recommended way to play even.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Her Ultimate and Chain Attack feature two Unique benefits. Her Ultimate deals additional 100% Daze to enemies with Shield whereas her Chain Attack has a very short animation. These features can help optimize certain fights or against certain Bosses, but otherwise remain less important as she is primarily a Support Agent. As such other characters Ultimates will take precedence over her usually. ","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Rounding off her kit, she has one more Passive bonus up her sleeve. Whenever she gains Retaliation or performs a Perfect Block or executes a Defensive Assist, she gets a buff called Stance Switch, granting her 20% Combat Impact for 3s (At Maximum). This makes the combo mentioned prior even stronger and doubles down on performing Retaliations, Perfect Blocks and Defensive Assists above anything else. ","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Caesar is one of the easiest to use and most impactful agents at the time of her release, offering insane damage increases, a busted Barrier that prevents damage, Interrupts attacks, and inflicts strong Daze with Defensive Assists in mind.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" Having both Defensive and Offensive utility, flexibility in team building, and strong numbers across the board makes her the best Support in the game and she will potentially remain there for quite a long time.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"For optimal strategies for combining all of Caesar’s skills, refer to the Rotation & Teams section of this guide.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

build.substats: [CRIT RATE = CRIT DMG > ATK% > PEN = ATK] OR [Anomaly Profiency > ATK% > PEN > ATK]

talents.name: Spearhead Advance
talents.desc: When Caesar enters combat or switches in, she instantly buffs the entire team with a Radiant Aegis shield, which can be can be triggered once every 300s. While Radiant Aegis is active, enemies within a 5m radius of the shield bearer suffer a 15% Attribute DMG RES reduction.

talents.name: Legacy of the Far Lands
talents.desc: While Radiant Aegis is active during Core Passive: Barrier of Resilience, Caesar's Energy Generation increases by 10%, and the shield bearer's attack boost is increased to 150% of its original value.

talents.name: Absolute Trust
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Aries the Battering-Ram
talents.desc: When Caesar uses a Chain Attack or Ultimate, she gains 3 additional Assist Points. If her Energy is below 20, she can activate EX Special Attack: Overpowered Shield Bash with 1 Assist Point instead. This substitution can only be triggered once every 5s.

talents.name: Romantic Conquest
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Overlord's Will
talents.desc: EX Special Attack: Overpowered Shield Bash and Assist Follow-Up is guaranteed to trigger a critical hit. The skill's DMG is increased by 50% with an additional damage of 50% dealt to the primary target. When Caesar uses EX Special Attack: Overpowered Shield Bash or Assist Follow-Up, her CRIT Rate is increased by 30% and her CRIT DMG is increased by 60% for 15s. Repeated triggers reset the duration.

","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

cons.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"All characters Corin can play with to activate her additional ability are either other DPS she doesn’t want to be paired with due to her high field time requirements or S-Ranks, making Corin’s team-building options somewhat limited.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Struggles to launch and fully charge her most powerful attacks on enemies without them moving, interrupting her, or needing to cancel the channel in order to reposition resulting in lower damage performance against more active targets.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has an entire kit built around dealing the majority of her damage while the enemy is Stunned causing her to feel somewhat lackluster outside of it.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Competes with many other A-Rank Physical DPS and even one with a reasonably similar playstyle (Piper).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

build.substats: CRIT RATE = CRIT DMG > ATK% > PEN = ATK

talents.name: Open Trauma
talents.desc: When Corin's Chain Attack or Ultimate hits an enemy, her DMG against the target increases by 12% for 15s.

talents.name: Atomic Smash
talents.desc: When Corin's EX Special Attack, Chain Attack or Ultimate hits an enemy, the target's Physical RES is reduced by 0.5%, stacking up to 20 times and lasting 5s. The duration of each stack is calculated separately.

talents.name: Amatuer Maid
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Battlefield Retainer
talents.desc: When Corin uses a Quick Assist, Defensive Assist, or Chain Attack, she recovers 7.2 Energy. This effect can trigger once every 16s.

talents.name: Special Ops Maid
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Accumulated Release
talents.desc: When Corin's extended slash hits an enemy, she obtains a stack of Charge (max 40 stacks). During a Dodge Counter, Special Attack, EX Special Attack, Quick Assist, or Assist Follow-Up, when her chainsaw detonation hits an enemy, consumes all stacks of Charge. Each stack consumed causes the attack to deal an additional 3% of ATK as DMG.

review.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Ellen is an S-Rank Ice Combat Agent specializing in delivering high amounts of pure Ice damage through her unique burst rotation and her ability to execute EX combos with the team’s Ultimate.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" Additionally, she maintains a consistent damage output against less formidable foes using a powerful sustained combo.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Ellen boasts high mobility, thanks to her signature sprinting state, which positions her as one of the fastest characters in the game. Her gameplay is centered around managing Flash Freeze charges, a resource exclusive to her, which powers her Enhanced Basic Attacks. ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"Mastering this allows Ellen to achieve one of the highest damage outputs in the game, cementing her status as a top-tier DPS in the endgame mode, Shiyu Defense.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Due to nuances of her kit, Ellen is considered one of the more complex characters ingame.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Ellen’s Basic Attack is a 3-hit combo integral to both her standard and burst rotations. It features two variants: a standard form dealing Physical damage and an enhanced form consuming Flash Freeze charges to deal Ice damage instead (requiring 3 Flash Freeze for a full 3-hit combo). In both forms, the first and second strikes are swift and relatively weak, while the third strike is a lengthier attack that can be extended further with continuous tapping. The third hit deals the majority of the combo's damage and triggers Ellen's teleportation behind her current or a new target if the original is eliminated or moves.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Ellen possesses standard Dodge, Dodge Counter, and Dash attacks common among characters.","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" Unique to her is the ability to hold down her Dodge to enter a special sprinting state known as the Roaming State. ","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"This state allows her to remain indefinitely sprinting and transforms her standard Basic Attack into Arctic Ambush, a critical component of her kit. Activating Arctic Ambush exits the Roaming State, delivering a chopping attack with her scissors that generates 1 Flash Freeze charge on hit. Alternatively, holding the Basic Attack button charges Arctic Ambush, increasing its damage and generating 3 Flash Freeze charges (ideal for executing a full Enhanced Basic Attack combo). Charging Arctic Ambush costs Ellen considerable field time, but executing a Perfect Dodge grants her the \"Quick Charge\" buff, significantly speeding up her next Charged Arctic Ambush from roughly 2 seconds to about 1.5 seconds.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Ellen’s Defensive Assist, Assist Follow-Up, and Quick Assist are standard attacks among melee characters, dealing Ice damage and/or inflicting Daze. ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"Notably, when she performs a Quick Assist, she also gains the \"Quick Charge\" effect mentioned before, in addition to the usual Perfect Dodge bonus.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Ellen possesses 3 Special Attacks: 1 Standard Special and 2 EX Specials. She utilizes her Standard Special sparingly, focusing instead on her EX Specials during burst rotations and situational use within her standard combo. The first EX Special can be activated when having sufficient energy, dealing Ice damage ahead of her, generating 1 Flash Freeze charge, and allowing an immediate Follow-Up with the third Basic Attack  of her Basic Attack combo. This sequence allows Ellen to quickly deal damage, generate a Charge, and then immediately use it via her powerful Basic combo, making her entire rotation go in a concise sequence. Ellen’s second EX functions similarly but with increased damage and the ability to induce Daze, requiring immediate use after her first EX. This choice gives Ellen flexibility: she can opt for EX1 followed by a Basic 3 or EX1 + EX2 followed by a Basic 3.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Ellen’s Chain Attack and Ultimate, smilar to her Assists, deliver substantial Ice damage and Daze. However, her Chain Attack requires more time to execute compared to other characters.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Ellen’s Core Passive is very strong, making it a nice incentive to approach 100% Critical Hit Rate without damaging her other stats.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" This passive grants up to 100% Crit damage to Arctic Assault, all her Flash Freeze-Enhanced attacks, including her Basics. Her Additional Ability is also formidable and should be activated as a priority. It grants a buff increasing her Ice damage by 3% each time she deals any Ice damage, stacking up to 10 times for 10 seconds. This ability is easily maintained, effectively providing a consistent 30% boost to Ice damage.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has incredible mobility while in the Roaming state, which allows for quick movement through levels and repositioning around bosses,","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Many abilities have movement and dodging components built into them, making Ellen more challenging for enemies to hit,","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has a decent amount of self-buffs built into her kit.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

build.substats: CRIT RATE = CRIT DMG > ATK% > PEN = ATK

talents.name: Glacial Omen
talents.desc: Upon hitting an enemy with a Swift Scissors during Dash Attack: Arctic Ambush, the obtained Flash Freeze Charges are increased to 3. Upon hitting an enemy with a Charged Scissors strike during Dash Attack: Arctic Ambush, the obtained Flash Freeze Charges are increased to 6. For each Flash Freeze Charge consumed, Ellen's CRIT Rate is increased by 2% for 15s, stacking up to 6 times. The duration of each stack is calculated separately.

talents.name: Arctic Ocean Predator
talents.desc: The 3rd hit of Basic Attack: Flash Freeze Trimming can be directly followed up with EX Special Attack: Sharknami. When using an EX Special Attack, each Flash Freeze Charge increases the current attack's CRIT DMG by 20%, up to a max of 60%.

talents.name: Overtime-Intolerant
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Endless Hoarfrost
talents.desc: Whenever a squad member Freezes or Stuns an enemy, Ellen gains 6 Flash Freeze Charges and the Quick Charge effect. She also recovers 4 Energy. The Energy recovery effect can trigger once per 10s.

talents.name: Adequate Sleep
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: The Feast Begins
talents.desc: When Ellen uses an EX Special Attack, Chain Attack, or gains Quick Charge, her PEN Ratio increases by 20% for 6s. She also gains 1 stack of The Feast Begins, up to a maximum of 3 stacks. With 3 stacks of The Feast Begins, using a Charge Scissor Strike during Dash Attack: Arctic Ambush consumes all stacks, increasing the DMG of the current attack by 250%.

introduction.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Less Is More, Simple Is Key. Complexity has no place here. Just keep everything simple. Work Smart and Rest More. Take breaks at the right time... to minimize the annoyance of working. Work With Focus, Prevail With Caution. Whether she takes it too seriously or not seriously enough, it's her enemy who ends up suffering from it. Unleash Sweet Delight, Unwrap and Indulge. Savoring the lollipop and concealing her true thoughts.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}
