pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Most attacks have a movement-based component which is controllable by the player making Grace one of the most mobile characters.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Incredibly fast damaging combos allow Grace to be played alongside another damage dealer as a Sub-dps without her competing for field time.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Deals the majority of her damage through Shock which after applied can be triggered by other characters while Grace isn’t even on the field.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"The backbone of the Shock team archetype making her a must-have if you want to play that team on release.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Incredibly cheap EX Special meaning it will be available far more frequently than other characters.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Incredibly active playstyle requiring accumulation and spending of charges on top of constant movement. Good for players who like a lot of action.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

cons.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Constant movement on abilities can sometimes lead to Grace being out of position if not controlled correctly.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Re-applying a Shock to an already Shocked target will not deal any additional damage but only refresh the duration making spamming out Shocks, while possible, a less efficient use of Grace's resources (Disorder can be used to solve this issue somewhat).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Strong damage potential but less straightforward to play as a sole damage dealer than other characters and prefers to be played alongside another damage dealer (such as Anton) in most cases.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her best and incredibly synergistic support (Rina) is an S-Rank and playing without her is noticeable, limiting Grace’s free-to-play power on release unless you get lucky.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

build.substats: Anomaly Proficiency > ATK% > PEN = ATK

talents.name: Recharge Chamber
talents.desc: When the 4th hit of Grace's Basic Attack hits an enemy, all squad members gain 0.25 Energy. Within the same move, this effect can grant a max of 2 Energy to all squad members.

talents.name: Lightning Piercer
talents.desc: When Grace's grenade hits an enemy during a Basic Attack, Special Attack, or EX Special Attack, the target's Electric RES is reduced by 8.5%, and Electric Anomaly Buildup RES is reduced by 8.5%, lasting for 8s.

talents.name: Chief Mechanic
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Burst Capacitor
talents.desc: When Grace uses her EX Special Attack, she gains 6 stacks of Charge (max 6 stacks). When her Basic Attack or Dash Attack hits an enemy, 1 stack of Charge is consumed, increasing her Energy Generation Rate of the attack by 20%.

talents.name: Frosty Cold Iron Witch
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Detonation Trigger
talents.desc: When all Zap stacks are consumed to activate a Special Attack or EX Special Attack, Grace's skill is enhanced, tossing an extra grenade and increasing each grenade's DMG to 200%.

introduction.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Such sharp and strong lines, truly beautiful... I can't help but want to open it up and take a look. \"Did you say Grace?\" Wrench jumped in and answered: \"Hm, she's the first person I've met nice enough to give me a massage.\" \"She's genuinely caring,\" Screw quickly added: \"Rather than being tightly wound, I prefer her way of tightening screws just right.\" Gear joined in at this point: \"Her intelligent mind is alluring and elegant as a well-engaged gearbox!\" \"And very rational,\" Oil muttered: \"In her dictionary, there's no room for 'a little' or 'moderate amount'. It's all precise 'milliliters'.\"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

review.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Harumasa is an S-Rank Melee/Ranged Hybrid Electric attack Agent sporting a Bow - and he isn’t afraid to get up and personal. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Harumusa blends the Ranged and Melee play styles seamlessly with options to shoot from afar or deal great close damage. Thanks to his lightning-fast Dashes or effective Disengage, he has no problem swapping back and forth between the two. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"With that said, his ideal rotations all involve him combining both at the same time.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" He has two other important components to his kit - the first being the ability to deploy Mobile Quivers which act as a sort of Landmine he can trigger with his attacks to deal a burst of damage and the second is his emphasis on dealing damage during the Stun window, something he gets many rewards for striving towards. To understand how that all plays out let’s dive into his kit.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Harumasa’s kit has a lot of text but his gameplay is actually incredibly simple and a lot of his abilities actually aren’t used in standard rotations.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" His game plan is very simple: deploy his Quivers, trigger them by firing an arrow to mark the target, Dash into Melee range to reap the benefits of said mark, rinse, repeat. Now that was probably a little too simple, so let's get into the actual specifics of how that works.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Harumasa’s unique resource is his Electro Quivers - this isn’t a resource that is tracked via a resource gauge but can be seen clearly on the field. There are four ways he can deploy Quivers:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"2 from Executing the 5th part of his Basic Attack combo Cloud Piercer.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"6 from Executing the 5th part of his Basic Attack combo Cloud Piercer ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"after the chain attack","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"6 from Executing a Chain Attack.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"6 from Executing an EX Special.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"6 when any squad member applies an Attribute Anomaly & no Quivers are currently active (12 Second Cooldown).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Haramusa can only have 6 Quivers active on the field at once and generating more with 6 active will only waste them.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" It’s no exaggeration to state that his damage and rotation live and die by how well you manage this resource. So what do you do with Quivers?","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Harumasa’s Basic Attack is split into 3 parts. The first is the standard 5-part Basic Attack combo - Cloud Piercer, made up of a mix of Physical and Electric hits. This combo is useful to deploy extra Quivers following a chain attack and you’ll be using it but only the latter portion - attacks 4 and 5 which can be executed immediately following some of his combos. The second is his charged Basic Attack Falling Feather which sees Harumasa draw his Bow, lock on, and fire at a target - doing so also activates all the Electro Quivers on the field causing them to deal damage to targets hit. This damage is the third part of his Basic Attack and is referred to as Ha-Oto no Ya. Each time an enemy is hit by Ha-Oto no Ya they’re afflicted with a stack of Electro Prison for up to a maximum of 8 stacks. While an enemy has at least 2 stacks of Electro Prison they are also X-Marked.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"To understand X-Marked and Electro Prison we first need to cover Harumasa’s Dodge abilities. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Harumasa’s standard Dash Attack and Dodge Counter are useful but not a critical part of his main combos -what is important though is the enhanced version of his Dash Attack called Hiten no Tsuru - Slash. While there is an enemy that is X-Marked, Harumasa enters the Awakened state granting him access to Hiten no Tsuru - Slash against that target. Hiten no Tsuru - Slash can be activated by performing a Dash combined with a Basic Attack and causes him to perform a rapid Dashing Strike toward the mark at the cost of consuming 2 stacks of Electro Prison per strike. Hiten no Tsuru - Slash consists of a 3-part attack combo with each attack consuming 2 stacks of Electro Prison. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"With this, we can form the basis of Harumasa’s combos.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Deploy 6 Electro Quivers","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Falling Feather (Activates all 6 Quivers Applying 6 Electro Prison & X-Marked)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Dash Attack: Hiten no Tsuru - Slash P1","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Dash Attack: Hiten no Tsuru - Slash P2","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Dash Attack: Hiten no Tsuru - Slash P3","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"With just this, you already know most of how to play Harumasa - of course, there’s still more to cover but this combo is what you’ll be repeating over and over with just slight alterations. An important tip also is that immediately following Falling Feather you can simply spam Basic Attack to execute the Slashes without needing to worry about combining Dash and Basic at the same time.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Harumasa’s Core Passive and Additional Ability double down on what we’ve already outlined.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" His Core Passive increases the CRIT RATE of Hiten no Tsuru - Slash by 25% at all times whilst also granting the Slash the ability to grant him a stackable buff called Gleaming Edge. Gleaming Edge grants Hiten no Tsuru - Slash 12% CRIT DMG per stack and can be stacked up to 6 times, lasts 10 seconds and is gained each time Hiten no Tsuru - Slash does a Critical Hit for a maximum of 3 stacks gained per individual strike. With a high CRIT RATE, you can expect to max out the stacks of this Passive easily by the third slash of Hiten no Tsuru. Harumasa’s Additional ability increases his DMG by 40% against enemies afflicted with any Attribute Anomaly or who are Stunned. Also when using Falling Feather against enemies that are Stunned or afflicted by an Attribute Anomaly, Harumasa generates an additional 2 Electro Prison.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"With this we can update our combo, it’s also important to note that in the event you can use additional Hiten no Tsuru - Slashes after the third, he will loop back to Part 2 after Part 3. Here is an example of what a combo against a Stunned target might look like:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Chain Attack (Deploys 6 Quivers)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Falling Feather (Activates all 6 Quivers Applying 8 Electro Prison & X-Marked)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Dash Attack: Hiten no Tsuru - Slash P1","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Dash Attack: Hiten no Tsuru - Slash P2","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Dash Attack: Hiten no Tsuru - Slash P3","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Dash Attack: Hiten no Tsuru - Slash P2","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"As mentioned earlier we can make use of Harumasa’s Basic Attack 4 and 5 to gain even more Quiver’s. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"It’s also important not to forget the additional Quivers that can be gained via squadmates applying Anomaly - don’t waste them and try to factor them into your combos as well!","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"To conclude, Harumasa is a burst damage specialist - deploy, activate, combo, repeat - preferably all being done during the enemy Stun window to gain massively increased damage and with preparation that can be made even more effective. Against enemies where the Stun window is shorter or more challenging to access, Harumasa will suffer. Furthermore, for players who aren’t willing to pursue preparation before his burst windows some of his potential will be lost.  ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"While he isn’t some new level of power, at the time of release he’s free and he gets the job done with a rather unique play style - if his kit appeals to you he’s a solid Electric damage pick.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Is a free character (but you have to grab him during the 1.4 patch),","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"His teams are the standard hypercarry compositions that are easy to learn and use,","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has the potential to perform even better as you master his rotation,","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has good Burst damage,","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Excellent mobility via quick Dash Attack engages and the option for swift disengages.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

cons.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Does significantly more damage against stunned enemies with a noticeable decrease outside of that,","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Requires more effort, planning, and skill to be played to maximum potential compared to other characters,","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Enemies that have shorter stun durations or resistance to being stunned limit Harumasa's burst potential.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

build.substats: CRIT DMG = CRIT Rate = ATK% > PEN = ATK

talents.name: High Spirit
talents.desc: The maximum stack limit of Electro Prison from Basic Attack: Ha-Oto no Ya increases to 14 stacks. When an Electro Quiver is triggered, 2 consecutive Ha-Oto no Ya will be fired at the target.

talents.name: Languish
talents.desc: When using an Chain Attack or Ultimate, Harumasa gains 7 stacks of Electro Blitz, up to a max of 7 stacks. While possessing Electro Blitz, the DMG of Dash Attack: Hiten no Tsuru - Slash increases by 50%. Consume 1 stack of Electro Blitz once Dash Attack: Hiten no Tsuru - Slash ends.

talents.name: White Lies
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Occasionally Motivated
talents.desc: Electro Prison now lasts for 20s. When Dash Attack: Hiten no Tsuru - Slash hits enemies, Harumasa gains 30 Decibels once per use of this skill. Upon activating Ultimate, apply maximum stacks of Electro Prison to all on-field enemies.

talents.name: No One Knows
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Tacit Understanding
talents.desc: After Ha-Oto no Ya hits Stunned enemies or enemies under Attribute Anomalies, Harumasa will ignore 15% of the target's Electric RES for 12s. Every 12 times an enemy is hit by Ha-Oto no Ya, trigger an extra electromagnetic explosion, dealing 1500% of Harumasa's ATK to the target as Electric DMG.

review.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Jane Doe, an S-Rank Melee Physical Combat Agent, excels in delivering exceptionally high damage through repeated triggers of the Assault Anomaly. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"What set Jane apart from the typical Anomaly-based characters is her mobility, rapid Anomaly build-up speed, a unique mode called \"Passion State,\" and the ability to cause her Assaults to CRIT. In the hands of a skilled player, Jane can dominate endgame content in various teams, making her one of the strongest DPS characters in the game (at the time of her release obviously).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"At the heart of Jane’s kit is the Passion Stream or simply \"Passion\". It's a resource gauge (exclusive to her) that serves as the foundation for all her combat actions. Using any ability( including Perfect Dodges and Defensive Assists) will generate Passion. Once the Passion gauge is fully charged, Jane enters a temporary berserk mode known as Passion State. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"This state enhances her abilities, increases her Physical Anomaly Buildup Rate by 25%, and grants her an additional 2 flat Combat Attack points for each point of Anomaly Proficiency she possesses over 120, capping at 600 flat Attack (which maxes out at 420 Anomaly Proficiency). ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"It's easy to say that Jane Doe transforms into a monster in this state. However, maintaining the Passion State indefinitely is a challenge. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"That's because her abilities that generated Passion now instead consume it.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" Once her Passion gauge depletes to 0, she exits the state. Jane's primary objective, along with the rest of her kit, revolves around repeatedly entering and sustaining the Passion State for as long as possible.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Jane Doe has two distinct Basic Attacks: a relatively standard six-part attack combo and far more powerful, charge-and-hold attack called \"Basic Attack: Salchow Jump.\" The latter can only be used once per entry into the Passion State, making it an important asset in Jane's offensive arsenal. First, let's talk about, Jane's standard six-part basic attack combo. It serves the dual purpose of building and consuming Passion and acts as Jane's filler ability - only used when no other skills are available. As with other characters, the latter attacks in Jane's combo are more powerful, and she can skip the earlier parts by executing Basic Attacks after specific actions. This allows for some potent combinations. Notably, many of these combination attacks vary depending on whether Jane is in the Passion State, providing unique sequences that enhance her overall damage output.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Jane’s charge-and-hold attack, Basic Attack: Salchow Jump, is a game-changer. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"This powerful move causes Jane to spin rapidly, dealing tons of damage to nearby enemies. Upon releasing the attack (or when the ability is canceled) Jane performs a powerful finishing move in front of her. While spinning, Jane gains a 40% reduction in damage taken and Anti-Interrupt capabilities - also during the finishing move, she becomes completely invulnerable. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"The best part of this ability is its ability to restore Passion, regardless of whether Jane is in the Passion State or not. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"This means that using this attack not only inflicts massive damage but also extends Jane’s time in the Passion State - this is helpful in reducing downtime and making it a must-use ability at every opportunity (although preferably after entering the Passion State and spending some Passion, so she can immediately recover it).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Jane's Mobility is further enhanced by her unique Dodge, Dash Attacks, and Dodge Counters. She has distinct versions of these moves depending on whether she is in the Passion State. While the animations differ - becoming notably cooler in the Passion State, their primary function remains consistent and the become stronger variants of their non-Passion counterparts.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Unlike most characters, Jane has access to three charges of Dodge instead of the usual two. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her standard non-Passion Dodge also features two alternating animations (without any impact on its functionality). In the Passion State, Jane’s Dodge is upgraded, allowing her to dodge through enemies rather than just away from them. Additionally, executing Perfect Dodges within the Passion State generates Passion.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Jane's non-Passion Dash Attack comes in two variants, corresponding to her separate dodge animations.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" In the Passion State, the Dash Attack is enhanced, making it longer to execute but dealing more damage and covering more distance. Jane can also follow her Passion-enhanced Dash Attacks with a Basic Attack skip to execute the following combo:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Dash Attack: Phantom Thrust (Passion)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Dancing Blades P4 (Passion)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Dancing Blades P5 (Passion)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Dancing Blades P6 (Passion)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Jane’s standard Dodge Counters, like her Dash Attacks, have two different animations but function as typical Dodge Counters. Reactivating Passion State allows you to use this attack again.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Jane Doe's Quick Assists, Defensive Assists, and Assist Follow-Ups are all standard attacks without much to show for compared to rest of her kit. Insight enhances all her attacks by applying the \"Gnawed State\" to enemies for 10 seconds. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"This passive also grants Jane the ability to ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"cause the Assault Anomaly to CRIT","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"—something that wasn't possible until now in Zenless Zone Zero. When an Assault triggers against an enemy in the Gnawed State, the chance for a CRIT to happen is set at a base of 40%. This chance can be increased by 0.16% for each point of Anomaly Proficiency Jane possesses (capping at 100% at 375 Anomaly Proficiency at max level). ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"The critical damage modifier is fixed at 1.5x and it's unaffected by other sources of Crit or Crit Damage (outside of Mindscapes). Additionally, assaults against Gnawed enemies will extend the \"Flinch\" debuff by 5 seconds with each hit, making Jane's attacks stronger over time.\n \nJane's Additional Ability: Sore Spot is activated by having any Anomaly or same-faction character on her team and boosts her Anomaly Buildup Rate. It provides an unconditional 20% bonus and an additional 15% when Jane attacks enemies already suffering from an Attribute Anomaly. This powerful enhancement is rather easy to activate, thankfully.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Jane Doe stands out as one of the most formidable Physical DPS agents at the time of her release.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" Her mobility, ability to deliver burst damage without ramp-up time (despite being Anomaly-based), and flexibility within the Disorder archetype make her a force to be reckoned with - whether she’s the sole DPS or working alongside other Anomaly characters, Jane’s future looks bright.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"For optimal strategies and to fully harness the power of Jane’s abilities, refer to the Rotation & Teams section of this guide.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Incredible mobility and 3 Dashes.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Absurdly fast and consistent Physical Anomaly buildup resulting in very frequent Assault Triggers.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Can cause Assault to critically strike - an additional multiplier not accessible to any other Anomaly character at the time of her release.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Strong damage in and outside of burst windows, making her viable all throughout the duration of combat.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Can drastically extend her Passion State in the hands of a skilled player thanks to multiple abilities resetting and extending the state when used optimally.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Can be used as a sole DPS or alongside other Anomaly characters in Disorder teams giving her great team-building flexibility and future prospects.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

cons.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"When not taking advantage of her Chain Attack or the team's Ultimate Jane requires meaningful field time to enter and take advantage of the Passion State.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Can lose significant power if enough Anomaly Proficiency cannot be acquired in order to activate her scaling abilities.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Can sometimes lose meaningful damage due to the Anomaly Trigger cooldown and the Anomaly Ability cap (Abilities that can only Trigger Assault at the end of their animation and can waste build-up if it exceeds 100% before the end of the animation)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

endgameStats.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"ATK: ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"2200 - 2600+ ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"HP: ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"9000 - 10000+","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"DEF: ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"800+ ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Anomaly Proficiency: ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"360 - 420+","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" (420 Required for cap of 600 Flat Combat Attack in Passion State) ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Anomaly Mastery: ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"148 - 195+ ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

build.substats: Anomaly Proficiency > ATK% > PEN = ATK

talents.name: Crime Counsel
talents.desc: The maximum uses of Basic Attack: Salchow Jump are increased by one. While in the Passion state, Jane's Physical Anomaly Buildup Rate increases by an extra 15% and each point of Jane's Anomaly Proficiency increases her damage by 0.1%, up to a maximum of 30%.

talents.name: Adapt to the Environment
talents.desc: When Jane's attack hits an enemy in the Gnawed state, or when any squad member triggers Assault on an enemy in the Gnawed state, 15% of the enemy's DEF is ignored. Additionally, when Assault DMG triggers a CRIT, the CRIT DMG is increased by 50%.

talents.name: Anonymity
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Adapt and Thrive
talents.desc: When any squad member triggers the Assault or Disorder effects, all squad members' Attribute Anomaly DMG is increased by 18%, lasting 15s.

talents.name: Compulsive Hoarder
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Shady Technique
talents.desc: While in the Passion state, Jane's CRIT Rate increases by 20%, and CRIT DMG by 40%. After any squad member inflicts Assault, Jane instantly enters the Passion state, and gains max Passion Stream. When Assault deals a CRIT, Jane performs an additional attack on the target, dealing Physical DMG equal to 1,600% of her Anomaly Proficiency.

introduction.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Jane, a criminal behavior specialist, has had a \"colorful\" career as a consultant with Public Security over the years. She is an expert in disguise, infiltration, and other investigative work. She has a bad habit of trolling others and sometimes plays harmless pranks. She's a skilled mimic, able to change her appearance and demeanor at will, making people wonder what the \"real\" Jane is like. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Gains temporary invincibility during the enhanced portions of her basic attack sequence allowing Koleda to ignore hits and finish her combo instead of dodging.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Very easy to play to her full potential.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Combining Koleda’s EX with an enhanced basic attack sequence delivers devastating amounts of daze.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Gain’s empowered abilities when in a party with Ben changing and improving some of her kit.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Additional ability (gained by having a Belobog or Fire teammate) is nice but not a dealbreaker to lose making Koleda feel fine to splash into team archetypes she doesn’t have direct synergy in (she can be used in every team without you feeling bad for losing something).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

cons.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has attack animations on the slower side with some attacks that lock her into completing them, sometimes causing Koleda to end up out of position unless you perform a character swap during them.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Non-enhanced basic attacks feel lackluster compared to her EX-enhanced basic combo making her feel somewhat EX-reliant outside of parrying and dodge countering.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Nothing that makes her outstanding outside of her great Daze and being a Fire element makes her subject to power creep.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

build.substats: CRIT RATE = CRIT DMG > ATK% > PEN = ATK

talents.name: Beat of the Hammer
talents.desc: After the 2nd or 4th hit of Koleda's Basic Attack or her enhanced Basic Attack, quickly use a Special Attack or EX Special Attack to increase the Daze dealt by 15%.

talents.name: Kinetic Recovery
talents.desc: When Koleda's EX Special Attack hits an enemy, she recovers 60 Energy. Can trigger once every 45s.

talents.name: Don’t Mess With Me!
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Furnace’s Glow
talents.desc: Koleda gains one stack of Charge (max 2 stacks) when consuming Furnace Fire to use her Enhanced Basic Attack. When her Chain Attack or Ultimate hits an enemy, she consumes all stacks of Charge to increase the attack's DMG by 18% per stack.

talents.name: You Dare Underestimate Me?
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Saturated Blast
talents.desc: When EX Special Attack, Chain Attack, or Ultimate triggers an explosion that hits an enemy, it deals additional DMG equal to 360% of Koleda's ATK.

introduction.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Small & Cute, With Some Fierce Combat Power. She may be small, but can certainly wield that huge hammer. A Fierce Young Girl Who's Also a President. The young leader at the helm of Belobog Industries. A President Who Leads by Example. She prefers to work out in the field, rather than being stuck at a desk. Leads by Example While Maintaining Her Cute Nature.\nHer maturity sometimes gives way to occasional childishness. She's a leader who sometimes needs to be taken care of by her followers.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

review.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Lighter is an S-Rank Melee Fire Stun Agent fulfilling the role of a low field time Daze character who also brings incredible supportive buffs for Ice and Fire teammates.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" Stun characters continue following a trend of picking up absurd supportive abilities and Lighter only takes this to the next level by sporting buffs that rival (and even exceed) many dedicated Support Agents - all the while fulfilling his role as a Stunner. Furthermore, he is the first Agent in the game capable of manipulating the duration enemies are Stunned for, allowing him to extend burst windows and doubling down on his supportive identity. ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"It wouldn’t be entirely inaccurate to call Lighter a Stun and Support Hybrid, but his Daze output is top class thus pushing him more in that direction, to learn more let's dive in.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Lighter’s kit is wordy and confusing… but his playstyle is anything but that. In combat he has one mission: wait in the wings allowing his teammates to fight until his unique resource bar “Morale” is between 80-100% filled, swap in, execute a flurry of devastating attacks consuming said “Morale” and swap out. This combo takes minimal time, applies all of his buffs, debuffs and delivers a strong amount of Daze.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Lighter’s Core Passive: Accelerant","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" is at the heart of his kit and is mandatory for his combo - as without it he would be dead in the water. Accelent allows him to gain up to 100 of his resource gauge “Morale” from two different sources. ","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"The first being his Passive, which allows him to gain 2.9 “Morale” every second regardless of the fact if he is on the field or not. ","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"The second source is reliant on your squad - for every 1 Energy your squadmates spend (Including Lighter himself) he’ll generate 0.26 “Morale”. ","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"For example, you’ll gain 15.6 “Morale” when an ally or Lighter spends 60 Energy on their EX Special.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"“Morale” isn’t usable until Lighter gains at least 80 of it, after which he gains access to a myriad of bonuses. The first of which is the ability to trigger a Quick Assist for ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"one time","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" the next time he switches in ignoring the usual rules of the Assist.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"The second is the ability to enter the “Morale Burst State” upon executing the 5th portion of his Basic Attack. While in the “Morale Burst State” he cannot generate “Morale” through his Passive or from Energy consumption.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"While in the “Morale Burst State” Lighter gains the following effects:","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Lighter’s 5th Basic Attack is enhanced causing it to consume “Morale” rapidly.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"For every 10 “Morale” consumed by Lighter, it grants him 2% Combat Impact for 6 seconds up to a maximum of 20%.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Any attack landed during the state applies a 15% ICE & FIRE RES Shred for 30 seconds.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Causes the final portion of his Basic Attack 5 to apply “Collapse” to any target hit. “Collapse” causes the next Stun the enemy suffers to be extended by an additional 3 seconds, “Collapse” cannot stack and is removed after the enemy recovers from Stun. ","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"After entering the “Morale Burst State” it’s heavily recommended you fully consume all of Lighter’s “Morale” swiftly and immediately to ensure you land the biggest Combat Impact buff possible, fully stack his buffs/debuffs and ensure you’re back to generating “Morale” as soon as possible.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Lighter’s Additional Ability: Fighting Spirit","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" is for the most part an extension of his Core Ability and absurdly powerful, ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"so ensure that you","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" build teams in order to activate it. Now what it does is that while within the “Morale Burst State” each of the hits caused by his 5th empowered Basic Attack grants all squad members a stack of “Elation” for a maximum of 20 stacks lasting for 30 seconds. While the 20 Stacks might sound like a lot, Lighter’s empowered 5th Basic Attack can hit many more times than that - so you’ll have no issues maxing this out when playing correctly. The “Elation” Buff grants those affected by it up to 75% FIRE and ICE DMG%. Each stack of “Elation” grants 1.25% FIRE and ICE DMG% or 25%... hold on then, what about the other 50%? For every 10 points of Impact Lighter possesses over 170, each “Elation” stack grants an additional 0.25% bonus for. ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"Thus at 270 Impact we’ll gain 3.75% DMG increase per stack instead, allowing him to reach the maximum bonus of 75%. ","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"The 30-second duration of this buff is huge in itself but as an added bonus whenever an ally performs a Chain Attack, its duration will be refreshed making its uptime pretty much permanent.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Phew… believe it or not that makes up for the majority of Lighter’s kit and as we’ve now learnt his whole kit essentially boils down to gaining access to 80 “Morale”, entering the “Morale Burst State” and executing an Empowered Basic Attack 5. Doing this applies all of his buffs and debuffs. With the wordy part covered lets breeze through the rest of his mostly simple kit.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Lighter has a TON of different Basic Attacks - all of which might have their place in certain niche and specialized combat scenarios… but, when it comes to his core gameplay you use barely any of them. ","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"His standard Basic Attack combo consists of 5 attacks - the first 3 are Physical and the last 2 are Fire. We want to avoid using the first 3 wherever possible, as they have poor multipliers across the board. Fortunately many of his abilities allow him to skip straight to executing either the 4th or 5th portion of the Basic Attack string - as such these are the abilities to watch out for:","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Dodge Counter: Blazing Flash (Skips to 5th Basic Attack)","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"EX Special Attack: V-Form Sunrise Uppercut (Skips to 4th Basic Attack)","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"EX Special Attack: V-Form Sunrise Uppercut - Dash Variant (Skips to 5th Basic Attack)","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Quick Assist: Blazing Flash - Guard (Skips to 5th Basic Attack)","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Assist Follow-Up: Reignition (Skips to 5th Basic Attack)","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"With proper planning, you’ll find yourself able to completely omit the first 3 - 4 Basic Attacks of the combo and skip straight to what matters the most - Basic Attack 5. Basic Attack 5 is further split up into 3 different parts and can only be fully accessed by Continuously Tapping or Holding the Basic Attack button throughout his 5 Basic Attack combo or after any of the follow-ups above. The three different parts of Basic Attack 5 are:","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"“StartUp”:","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"“StartUp” is a flurry of punches that follows right up after executing his Basic Attack 4 but ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"will not be present if you skipped directly to Basic Attack 5 via another ability. ","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}]}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"“Combo”:","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"“","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"Combo” is a continual flurry of punches that hits many many times in quick succession (And this is how we reach 20 stacks of “Elation”). ","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"“Finisher”:","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"“Finisher” is exactly how it sounds: a huge haymaker to finish the combo off. ","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"While in the “Morale Burst State” each of these abilities consumes “Morale” and is, enhanced dealing more Damage and Daze whie also gaining additional effects. When enhanced “Combo” can be repeated as long as you possess “Morale” to consume, doing so will allow you to extend your flurry of punches to stack “Elation”, it’s always a good idea to channel “Combo” until 0 “Morale” because of the next enhancement. When running out of “Morale” while executing the 5th Basic attack within “Morale Burst State” Lighter’s “Finisher” is supercharged into “Powerful Finisher” dealing further increased Daze and Damage. Another bonus of running your “Morale” to 0 with “Combo” is that it ensures “Powerful Finisher” will have the maximum Combat Impact % buff from his Core Passive.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"An additional note is that Lighter’s Basic attack combo can be fully chained and executed simply by holding down the Basic Attack button. ","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"Also as mentioned earlier his Basic Attacks do have more to them but with his current top playstyle they’re not worth delving into. With “Morale” up, get to Basic Attack 5 as fast as possible, dump all “Morale” into repeating the “Combo” portion and land a huge “Powerful Finisher”.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Lighter’s EX-Special Attack costs 40 Energy, deals good Daze, damage, and of course helps him recover some “Morale” while also skipping straight to Basic Attack 4. What makes it stand out though is that Lighter can tap EX-Special again right after its use to execute a Follow-Up Attack at the cost of an additional 20 Energy. This is usually well worth it as the attack doesn’t take much longer to execute and deals good Daze for its Energy cost. Lighter’s EX-Special also has an alternative mode which can be accessed by hitting the EX-Special key right after a Dash - something that isn’t easy to do consistently without some practice. As mentioned above the Dash-EX allows you to skip to Basic Attack 5 instead of 4.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Lighter’s Chain Attack and Ultimate are completely standard - even a bit boring you might say.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" His Ultimate doesn’t do anything special so the team's resources are usually better spent elsewhere and while his Chain Attack can be used if there is a slot available, it is a low priority compared to those who need it more.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"As with most Stun characters, Lighter’s Dodge Counter is actually surprisingly strong having good multipliers and allowing him to immediately skip straight to Basic Attack 5 - use it when the opportunity presents itself.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Lighter’s assists like his Dodge Counter are strong and absolutely worth using. ","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"The combo of his Defensive Assist + Assist Follow-Up should be the go-to for you when playing him, as he prefers to stay off-field most of the time. Remain on-field with your other two characters but Hot-Swap to Lighter to execute his Defensive Assist + Assist Follow-Up while you wait for his “Morale” to recover for his next combo. It’s worth noting when you finally do reach 80-100 “Morale” entering combat via a Defensive Assist + Assist Follow-Up is the optimal way to maximize Daze output. Lighter’s Quick assist is also very useful, you’ll gain free access to it every time you reach 80 “Morale” in the resource bar. If you reach 80-100 “Morale” and you don’t see an opening to Swap-In Lighter optimally, following the above this is your go to for a quick skip to the 5th Basic Attack.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"With Lighter’s kit fully covered let's bring all of it together. Here’s the final game plan:","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Wait until Lighter reaches 80 - 100 “Morale” (100 will maximize his Core Passive bonuses and is recommended in most cases).","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Swap to Lighter Via a Defensive Assist + Assist Follow-Up OR a Quick Assist.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Hold down the Basic Attack to execute Basic Attack 5 “Combo” to fully drain your “Morale” and trigger his “Powerful Finisher”.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"If Energy is available add in either an EX Special or EX Special + Follow-Up.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Here it is listed in abilities:","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Defensive Assist: Swift Break","marks":[{"type":"italic"}],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Assist Follow-Up: Charging Slam - Stab","marks":[{"type":"italic"}],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Basic Attack: L-Form Thundering Fist (5th-Hit Combo)(Morale Boosted)","marks":[{"type":"italic"}],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Basic Attack: L-Form Thundering Fist (5th-Hit Powerful Finisher)(Morale Boosted)","marks":[{"type":"italic"}],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"EX Special Attack: V-Form Sunrise Uppercut - Full Distance                ","marks":[{"type":"italic"}],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"EX Special Attack: V-Form Sunrise Uppercut - Full Distance (Follow-Up)   ","marks":[{"type":"italic"}],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"And that’s really it. The above will grant you all of Lighter’s buffs, debuffs, and do a large amount of Daze. If you’re looking for more though here are some additional things you can watch out for.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"In the rare case Lighter is on the field execute Dodge Counters for more Daze Build-Up","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Ensure you never overcap on Energy - swap Lighter in to execute EX-Special’s even outside his usual combo if you’re about to overcap.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Perform Defensive Assists + Assist Follow-Ups whenever possible for additional Daze.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Optionally execute Non-Morale sequences of Basic Attack 4 + 5 to take advantage of the skips granted by your other abilities (The Daze output from these isn’t stellar but can fill empty field time or get you the last bit of the way to a stun)","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"In combat scenarios that don’t demand Lighter’s full burst combo (Non-elite enemies) tactically use his EX, Defensive Assist, or Dodge counter to trigger Stuns as needed.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Lighter is an incredible Stun character fully capable of serving as a support and at the same time, he has crazy buffs/debuffs, huge burst Daze, extended Stuns and is simple to play.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" He has a few downsides but nothing deal-breaking. Reaching 270 Impact to fully activate his 75% bonus via his Additional Ability isn’t trivial though, and you'll need Impact-focused W-engines to make it happen - which depending on your account might pose a challenge. And of course, Lighter is a Fire and Ice specialist so if those elements aren’t for you, he loses a lot of his value. If those aren’t a problem though, Lighter is definitely a force to be reckoned with.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Incredible full team ICE and FIRE DMG% Boost.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Grants substantial ICE and FIRE RES% Shred.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Extends enemy Stun duration by 3 seconds, allowing for larger burst windows.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has an incredibly front-loaded combo capable of taking up minimal field time if desired.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Simple and easy to play.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

build.substats: [CRIT RATE = CRIT DMG > ATK% > PEN = ATK] or [ATK% = Anomaly Proficiency > ATK > PEN]

talents.name: The Champion
talents.desc: Among the debuffs imposed by Core Passive: Accelerant, the Collapse effect increases Stun duration by 5s, while further reducing Ice RES and Fire RES by 10%. The more powerful Finishing Move that follows when Lighter's Morale is completely exhausted during a startup light punch or jab combo deals 30% increased DMG.

talents.name: Red Scarf
talents.desc: When applying Collapse by Core Passive: Accelerant to enemies, the target's Stun DMG Multiplier increases by 25%. The increase to Ice DMG and Fire DMG provided by Elation from Additional Ability: Fighting Spirit increases to 120% of the original.

talents.name: Mercenary Leader
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Sunglasses
talents.desc: When Lighter is off-field, the Energy Regen for the on-field character is increased by 10%. Upon entering the Morale Burst state, Lighter restores 4 Energy for off-field characters. This effect can trigger once every 18s.

talents.name: Decision Maker
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Inhuman Blood
talents.desc: Lighter's Morale recovery efficiency is increased to 200% of its original value. When Lighter lands a heavy strike on enemies during a Basic Attack, Dodge Counter, Special Attack, EX Special Attack, Quick Assist, Assist Follow-Up, Chain Attack, or Ultimate, it will trigger the Blazing Impact effect, dealing 250% of ATK as Fire DMG. This effect can trigger once every 8s on each enemy. If Lighter's Impact exceeds 170 points, each additional point will further increase the multiplier of Blazing Impact by 5%, up to a maximum increase of 500%. The more powerful Finishing Move that follows when Lighter's Morale is completely exhausted during a light punch or jab combo will trigger an additional activation of Blazing Impact when hitting an enemy, ignoring the effect's cooldown.

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has up to 3 pet guard boars that attack, dealing a small amount of damage and Daze.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Guard boars stay on the field and keep attacking even while Lucy leaves the field.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Grants the whole squad (including Bangboo and guard boars) a 600 flat ATK buff, assuming Lucy’s own personal Attack is high enough to cap out the buff.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Very very easy to play without much to do or mess up in order to bring out her full potential.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has different teams she is very very good in and a few where she is even the best - making her flexibility in teams incredibly good.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Doesn’t require her additional ability in order to fully unlock her supportive capabilities although she will lose some of her potential guard boar damage.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has two separate EX moves to choose from depending on the situation at hand.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

cons.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Guard boars can sometimes have trouble keeping up and hitting faster enemies in melee range, leading to them chasing enemies instead of constantly attacking.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Requires a high amount of personal Attack to grant her allies the full most powerful 600 flat Attack buff.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

build.substats: ATK% (top priority until ability cap) = CRIT RATE = CRIT DMG  > PEN = ATK

talents.name: Drill Formations
talents.desc: When the guard boars launch Guard Boars: Spinning Swing!, Lucy recovers 2 Energy. This effect can trigger once every 15s, with each guard boar having its own separate cooldown.

talents.name: Little Boar Captain
talents.desc: When Lucy uses a Chain Attack or Ultimate, it grants all squad members, Bangboo, and the guard boars the Cheer On! status for 10s.

talents.name: Ironfist Overseer
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Chaos Ball Game
talents.desc: While in the Cheer On! state, allies' CRIT DMG is increased by an additional 10%.

talents.name: Wildland Princess
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Fierce Fangs of Fire
talents.desc: When an ally in the Cheer On! state hits an enemy with an EX Special Attack, a guard boar will drop from the sky and cause an explosion, dealing Fire DMG equal to 300% of the guard boar's ATK. This will extend the duration of the Cheer On! buff for all squad members by 5s. The duration can increase up to 3 times, with a maximum duration of 30s. Refreshing the Cheer On! state resets the stack count. After the guard boar's explosion, it will launch Guard Boars: Spinning Swing!.

introduction.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"\"An honored guest just arrived. Allow me, Lady Lucy, to entertain you!\" Luciana Auxesis Theodoro de Montefio ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Additional ability amplifies the standard Stun multiplier from 150% to 185% increasing team burst damage during the Stun window tremendously.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Core ability applies 25% Ice Res Shred for 30 seconds allowing for near infinite uptime on enemies boosting the damage of Ice characters by an incredible amount.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Deals massive amounts of Daze unconditionally with his charged basic attack combo allowing him to act as a main field Dazer delivering absurd Daze on the field while still having the option to support a Main DPS with Parries and EX’s when they are available.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has access to incredible teammates, allowing Lycaon to form one of the strongest teams in the game (Mono-Ice).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Despite being incredible in Ice damage-focused teams, he can still provide value outside of them thanks to his incredible Daze and bonus stun multiplier.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}
