build.substats: CRIT RATE = CRIT DMG > ATK% > PEN = ATK

talents.name: Full Moon Momentum
talents.desc: When Lycaon's EX Special Attack hits an enemy, the attack's Daze increases by 12%. This effect can trigger once every 8s. When he charges his EX Special Attack to completion, this buff will increase by an additional 10%.

talents.name: Energy Feedback
talents.desc: When Stunning an enemy or triggering a squad member's Chain Attack, Lycaon gains 5 Energy. Can trigger once every 1s.

talents.name: Attendant Training
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Graceful Demeanor
talents.desc: If Lycaon is attacked while using a Basic Attack or Special Attack, he will immediately gain a Shield effect equal to 7.5% of his max HP, lasting for 15s. During the Shield's duration, his Anti-Interrupt level is increased. This effect can trigger once every 15s.

talents.name: Alpha Nature
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Ruthless Hunter
talents.desc: When a charged attack hits an enemy, the target suffers 10% increased DMG from Lycaon, stacking up to 5 times and lasting 12s. Only one stack can be gained per skill use, and repeated triggers reset the duration.

introduction.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Can resolve any matter. The most trusted of attendants, and solid support for any team. Rational and wise, a true gentleman who can't tolerate a single stain. Offers absolute loyalty to the one he decides to follow. Though outwardly sophisticated and rational, his innate feral character will reveal itself when faced with certain dangers.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

review.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Miyabi is an S-Rank Melee Frost Anomaly Agent and is the first (and perhaps the last) Frost character ZZZ will see.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" In addition to bringing a new element to the game, she is also the first Anomaly unit that specifically only wants a CRIT-based build. Yeah. Miyabi really is the odd character that breaks all the rules. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Now, what does she bring to the table? ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"The answer is a simple one - an absurd amount of damage","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":", more than any other character released so far to the point of setting a new bar for what to expect in the future. Similar to Yanagi and Jane, Miyabi continues the trend of Anomaly characters dealing huge burst damage up front, making her just as effective at immediate damage as any DPS character currently released. To understand how to get the most out of the powerhouse that is Miyabi let’s dive into her kit.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"While in combat, her game plan is simple: she wants to execute her most powerful attack - Basic Attack: Shimotsuki at the right time, being fully charged and as frequently as possible","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":". Shimotsuki is an enhanced version of her Basic Attack accessible by pressing and holding the button to charge. It can be charged up to 3 times based on her resources on hand and upon reaching max charges, it deals as much damage as most other characters' Ultimates. As such, the entirety of Miyabi’s kit and rotation will revolve around generating resources for fully charged Shimotsuki and timing them just right. So let's learn exactly how to do that.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Her unique resource is a special gauge consisting of 6 Orbs called “Fallen Frost”.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" “Fallen Frost” is how you access and charge her enhanced Basic Attack Shimotsuki, as such accumulating “Fallen Frost” is always of the utmost importance. Miyabi can generate “Fallen Frost” in the following ways:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"3 Orbs upon entering the battle for the first time (only happens once).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"3 Orbs upon releasing her Ultimate.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"2 Orbs upon using either of her EX Special attacks (4 when both are used together).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"2 Orbs when any squad member triggers Disorder.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"1 Orb upon triggering Frostburn - Break via Frost Anomaly (10-second cooldown).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"As you can see, that’s a lot of ways to gain Orbs but Miyabi needs all 6 filled before she can unleash her most powerful attack - something you’ll want to be saving for each time.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Miyabi’s Basic Attacks are how we’ll be not only spending “Fallen Frost” but also filling some downtime. Her Basic Attacks are split into two different abilities. The first is a standard 5 part combo consisting of 2 Physical attacks initially and 3 Frost attacks at the end. The second is her charged Basic Attack: Shimotsuki which can only be accessed when you have at least 2 Orbs of “Fallen Frost”. Each charge of Shimotsuki requires 2 additional Orbs of “Fallen Frost” to access, with the most powerful version requiring 6 Orbs (3 Charges). Outside of Shimotsuki, her rotations also make use of her standard Basic Attack combo albeit with some skips accessed via ability sequencing. The most common of these skips is being able to bypass using the first 2 Physical attacks of the combo by using an EX Special Attack immediately followed by Basic Attacks allowing for the following combo:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"EX Special Attack: Hisetsu","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Kazahana P3","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Kazahana P4","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Kazahana P5","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"This skip is important as we want to use her Frost Basic Attacks specifically in order to fully build up Frost Anomaly to gain the Orb of “Fallen Frost” that comes along with it. To sum it up - use her charged Basic Attack when you have 6 Orbs and use ability skips to access parts 3, 4, and 5 of her standard Basic Attack combo to build any additional Anomaly you need.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Speaking of Anomaly, it's time to talk about Frost. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Frost works like every other Anomaly when it comes to buildup - that is, use abilities of the Frost type and you’ll gain Frost buildup. Frost has a lot of similarities with the Ice Anomaly. Fully filling the Frost gauge will apply Freeze, Frostbite, and upon Freeze ending a Shatter. Where it differs from Ice is that it has a higher Anomaly multiplier and most importantly of all ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"is not Ice","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" meaning its build-up and Anomaly are separate allowing you to trigger Disorders between Ice and Frost Anomalies (very handy when playing Miyabi with other Ice Agents).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"As an Anomaly unit Miyabi needs some way to boost her Anomaly damage and that's where her Core Passive comes in. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Whenever Miyabi hits an enemy with any Frost damage she applies Icefire to them increasing her Frost Anomaly buildup against them by 100% of her CRIT RATE up to a maximum of 80% (80% CRIT Rate = 80% Frost Anomaly Buildup Rate). Also when Miyabi triggers her Frost Anomaly she’ll consume all Icefire on the target to inflict a Frostburn - Break, dealing a large amount of damage which can be a Critical hit, generating an Orb of “Fallen Frost” and placing them in the Frostburn state. While in the Frostburn state, ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"the target suffers 20% more Anomaly buildup from all your squad members at the cost of Miyabi being unable to apply Icefire during this time","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":". Frostburn lasts as long as the enemy is afflicted with Frostbite, which can be removed by triggering a Disorder - something Miyabi just so happens to want to happen thanks to it granting 2 Orbs of Fallen Frost.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"So it basically boils down to: aim for 80% CRIT RATE to get the maximum bonus, trigger Frost Anomaly as fast as you can for the orb of “Fallen Frost” and bonus damage from Frostburn - Break, and use another character to leverage Frostburn to trigger disorder for even more “Fallen Frost” Orbs.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Miyabi has two EX Specials both of which are standard Frost attacks with the exception being that they generate 2 Orbs of “Fallen Frost” each. Both attacks consume 40 Energy with the second only being usable immediately following the first. If you need a full 4 Orbs of “Fallen Frost” up front using both the initial and follow-up EX is effective, but if you only need two or want to leverage the ability to skip Basic Attacks using only the first EX is also a valid choice.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Miyabi’s Ultimate delivers massive Frost damage, grants her a 30% Ice DMG boost for 12 seconds (Applies to Frost Attacks), and generates 3 Orbs of “Fallen Frost” - you should aim to use this during the Stun window. Her Chain attack is even simpler; it just deals huge AoE Frost damage but unfortunately, no “Fallen Frost” Orbs are generated here.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Similar to her Chain Attack, Miyabi’s Dash Attacks, Dodge Counter, and Assists are simple and as standard as they come with no special effects or bonuses - use them as needed like you would on other agents. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Rounding out her kit is Miyabi’s Additional ability and it’s a big one. While active her Basic Attack: Shimotsuki gains a 60% DMG increase, ignores 30% Ice RES (works for Frost as well) and whenever any squad mate triggers Disorder she gains 2 “Fallen Frost” Orbs.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Now it’s time to bring it all together and cover how to combine these abilities alongside some optimizations you can make to take Miyabi’s damage to the next level.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Fight Opener","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"heading-6"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"When opening a fight we know Miyabi starts with 3 Orbs of “Fallen Frost”, we can use this to our advantage. Executing a single EX Special alongside the follow-up combo of 3 Basic Attacks can be enough to trigger the Frost Anomaly on many enemies allowing for an immediate activation of a fully charged Shimotsuki to kick the fight off.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"EX Special Attack: Hisetsu P1 (5 Orbs)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Kazahana P3","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Kazahana P4","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Kazahana P5 (Triggers Frost Anomaly 6 Orbs)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Shimotsuki (Fully Charged)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Against enemies with higher Anomaly gauges this doesn’t work; you can add extra attacks to achieve a similar opening effect.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Standard Combo","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"heading-6"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Without the assistance of her starting 3 Orbs, Miyabi instead has to rely on her energy and EX’s or her teammates and Disorder triggers in order to gain Fallen Frost. Here are a few examples of how that plays out.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Example 1:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Ally Applies Anomaly to Enemy","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"EX Special Attack: Hisetsu P1 (2 Orbs)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"EX Special Attack: Hisetsu P2 (4 Enemy (2 Orbs)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"EX Special Attack: Hisetsu P1 (4 Disorder 6 Orbs)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Shimotsuki (Fully Charged)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"In both examples Miyabi can easily access her fully charged Shimotsuki but bouncing back and forth between applying her Frost Anomaly and then consuming it with another team member to trigger Disorder allows for much greater energy efficiency.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Ultimate Combo","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"heading-6"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Miyabi’s Ultimate should ideally always be used when the enemy is Stunned but thanks to the 3 “Fallen Frost” charges it grants it mixes up the possibilities a little bit. Like with the combos above, including a Disorder trigger or at the very least an Anomaly application from an ally is ideal. Here is what to shoot for:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Chain Attack","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Ultimate (Triggers Frost Anomaly & Disorder 2 + 3 + 1 Orbs)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Shimotsuki (Fully Charged)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Many more combos are possible than just these with Miyabi and the examples above are only just that - examples. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"One other thing to note when playing her is the possibility of Quick Swap.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" The animation time on Basic Attack: Shimotsuki is painfully slow and if you swap the character after fully charging it, Miyabi will in fact fully execute the attack even while you’re playing another character. Because of this performing a “Quick-Swap” after fully charging can save you a lot of time and boost her DPS massively (recommended for those looking to maximize performance).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"To conclude Miyabi absolutely takes the word damage to a new level in ZZZ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" - she’s incredibly fun to play, has a heap of flavor with her charged attacks & Frost element, and has a lot of teams she’s viable in. If you’re after power she’s a good choice, if you’re a fan of her design you can rest easy as she’s a top performer at the time of her release.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Absurdly large damage multipliers giving \"hit like a truck\" a new meaning,","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Huge AoE on many attacks, allowing her to quickly deal with big groups of monsters,","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"A good amount of team options for both spenders and F2P,","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"She sets a new bar for how strong a DPS can be in the game.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

cons.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"As one of the first CRIT Anomaly characters her W-Engine options outside her signature are limited,","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Relies on applying Frost Anomaly at specific points in her combo for maximum effectiveness - disruption to this can cause issues,","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Really wants to achieve 80% CRIT RATE for the 80% Anomaly Buildup to assist with the point above, making her stat-hungry,","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Rotations and playstyle can drastically change based on team composition leading to a steep path to mastery,","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has many long animations which you'll want to Quick Swap to another squad member to alleviate. This introduces a new axis of skill for those looking for the best results.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

build.substats: CRIT RATE (Until 80%) >= CRIT DMG = ATK% > Anomaly Proficiency = ATK = PEN

talents.name: Frost Atop the Snow
talents.desc: While in Shimotsuki Stance, every 1 point of Fallen Frost consumed will allow Basic Attack: Shimotsuki to ignore 6% of DEF, stacking up to 6 times and lasting until Shimotsuki Stance ends. When the slash for charge level three of Basic Attack: Shimotsuki hits an enemy under Frostburn, it will immediately remove the Frostburn state and increase all squad members' Anomaly Buildup Rate by 20% for 10s.

talents.name: Breath Technique
talents.desc: Basic Attack: Kazahana and Dodge Counter DMG increases by 30%. Hoshimi Miyabi gains 1 point of Fallen Frost when the final move of the 5th hit of Basic Attack: Kazahana hits an enemy. Upon entering the battlefield, Hoshimi Miyabi immediately obtains 6 points of Fallen Frost and her CRIT Rate increases by 15%.

talents.name: Martial Discipline
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Rupture
talents.desc: Frostburn - Break DMG increases by 30%. Upon triggering Frostburn - Break, Hoshimi Miyabi generates 250 more Decibels.

talents.name: Anniversary
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Prodigious Talent
talents.desc: During Shimotsuki Stance, Hoshimi Miyabi obtains Polar, which increases Basic Attack: Shimotsuki DMG by 30%. After obtaining Polar, Hoshimi Miyabi will automatically draw her blade and unleash powerful slashes based on the current charge level upon consuming Fallen Frost. Before Fallen Frost is completely depleted, the draw and slashes will not interrupt charging under Shimotsuki Stance. Each occurrence of Shimotsuki Stance can perform up to 3 draws and slashes.

introduction.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"The head of Hollow Special Operations Section 6, and the successor of a renowned martial art family in New Eridu. With her strong sense of responsibility towards guarding the principles and order within New Eridu, Miyabi aspires to build an unbreakable city management system... and to own a sizable collection of swords (her own words).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has great AoE coverage on her Ultimate, Chain, and Dodge Counter allowing for easy cleanup of weaker enemies.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Multiple team synergies among free-to-play characters even if they aren’t as strong as other characters' best teams.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Incredible mobility with a Dash Attack that is a borderline teleport.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Fast attacking and dodge-based kit perfect for those who enjoy a fast-paced playstyle.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Incredibly cheap EX Special meaning it will be available far more frequently than other characters.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

cons.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Requires constant use of Dodge Counters or Quick Assists in order to keep her Core passive ability active whereas many other characters get theirs permanently active for free.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"During Stun damage windows when the enemy cannot attack, Nekomata must rely on her Support to grant her a Quick Assist or go without a large damage bonus.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Is a Physical damage dealer and there are three A-Rank characters from this element - one of which is free - meaning she has by far the most competition for her role within her element, making her relative value compared to other elemental S-Rank drop.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has incredibly limited team synergy options. There is no Physical support or Stun characters and the characters from her faction Cunning Hares only have mediocre synergy with her at best. This results in lower endgame potential for her at the time of her release.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

build.substats: CRIT RATE = CRIT DMG > ATK% > PEN = ATK

talents.name: Bird Hunter
talents.desc: When Nekomata hits an enemy from behind, she ignores 16% of the target's Physical RES. If the enemy is Stunned, all Nekomata's attacks are considered back attacks.

talents.name: Cat & Mouse
talents.desc: When there's only one enemy on the field and Nekomata is in combat, her Energy Generation Rate is increased by 25%.

talents.name: Curious Left Tail
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Sharpen Claws
talents.desc: When Nekomata uses her EX Special Attack, her CRIT Rate increases by 7% for 15s, stacking up to 2 times, with each stack's duration being calculated separately.

talents.name: Lucky Right Tail
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Predator Lineage
talents.desc: When Nekomata launches a Chain Attack or uses her Ultimate, her CRIT DMG increases by 18%, stacking up to 3 times, and expiring when she's no longer in-combat. This effect gains maximum stacks immediately on defeating an enemy.

introduction.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"\"The best mackerel is always the one you haven't eaten yet~\" — Nekomiya Mana. Spirited and mischievous, she likes to play tricks on others. Your wallet is her wallet. (Really... It's hers now.) Athletic and daring, no Hollow is too dangerous for her. \"Cats love fish\" is actually an incorrect stereotype. But Nekomata does love fish... She's seen a lot of cat-astrophy and \"curiosity killed the cat\" moments, and seen many a secret that can't be told.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Can apply a very large Defense Shred debuff on enemies increasing the damage they take considerably.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Increases the entire squads' Ether damage by 25% while her Additional Ability is active","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"She’s free!","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"One of the only characters that synergizes with characters such as Billy and Nekomata due to the limited roster of characters on release in 1.0.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

cons.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"There are no Ether damage characters for Nicole to support on release, but this will quickly change with the release of Zhu Yuan - still, for now, her Ether boost is only useful for herself.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Requires specific timing or constant swapping to maintain good uptime of DEF shred debuff on enemies due to its low duration.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

build.substats: Anomaly Proficiency = ATK% > PEN = FLAT ATK

talents.name: Supercharged Bomb
talents.desc: The DMG and the Anomaly Buildup inflicted by Nicole’s EX Special Attack increases by 16%. For each additional 0.1s of charging when Nicole activates her EX Special Attack, the duration of the energy field created at the target location increases by 0.15s.

talents.name: Charging Device
talents.desc: Nicole recovers 5 Energy when Core Passive: Mechanical Case's debuff is triggered. This effect can trigger once every 15s.

talents.name: A Hare’s Cunning
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Field Expansion
talents.desc: When Nicole uses her EX Special Attack, Chain Attack, or Ultimate, the diameter of the energy field generated at the target location is increased by 3m.

talents.name: Industry Star
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Corrupting Energy Field
talents.desc: When Nicole’s energy fields deal DMG to an enemy, all squad members CRIT Rate against that enemy increases by 1.5%, stacking up to 10 times, and lasting 12s. The duration of each stack is calculated separately.

introduction.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"The leader of the odd-job agency the Cunning Hares, who accept all kinds of Hollow-related commissions. She's been on the streets for many years, and has a reputation among her peers as being exceedingly cunning. She's been blacklisted by many clients due to her all-or nothing approach. She loves money, but is surprisingly bad at managing it, leaving the \nCunning Hares constantly on the edge of bankruptcy and owing many debts.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

introduction.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Hmph, what in the world is so appealing about lottery tickets anyway? Victory and defeat are completely out of your own control!","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

review.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Qingyi is an Electric S-Rank Melee Stun Agent, with strong Combo attacks that overwhelm enemies with Daze and amplify Stun damage multipliers to next level. ","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"This unique combination makes Qingyi one of the top Support/Stun characters in the game, especially valuable for burst DPS aiming to maximize damage during the Stun window.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"However, as a combo-based character, Qingyi requires significant field time to be played optimally. ","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"You can expect her to dominate the majority of the team's on-field time while the enemy is not Stunned.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Qingyi's kit revolves around building and spending her unique resource gauge, ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"Flash Connect Voltage, or simply Voltage","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":". All of Qingyi’s Electric damage attacks generate Voltage, which she can store up to 100 units. Voltage is essential for activating her empowered Basic Attack, Enchanted Moonlit Blossoms, which requires a minimum of 75 Voltage. This attack is important for maximizing Daze potential and applying her powerful Stun damage multiplier. Qingyi’s primary objective on the field is to build and spend Voltage as quickly and efficiently as possible. In order to learn how to do that, let’s take an in-depth look at her abilities.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Qingyi's Basic Attack sequence consists of four attacks and a charged Basic Attack, accessible by pressing and holding. Each of these attacks have multiple variants – some being must-use, while others being worthless.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"The first two attacks deal Physical Damage. These are relatively weak compared to her later attacks and should be not used whenever possible - the reason being 3rd and 4th attack combo being superior in damage, able to generate Voltage, making it important that you try to minimize these attacks to only be used during any downtime. ","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"The third attack is a multi-hit Electric assault that generates significant Voltage and can be repeated indefinitely by rapidly tapping the Basic Attack button. This attack is essential for Voltage generation and can be combined with Dodges to maintain positioning without interrupting the combo.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"After sustaining the third attack for a set period of time, Qingyi emits a flash, empowering her fourth attack. It is recommended to finish off the Basic Attack combo at this point. Her 4th attack can be immediately executed by halting execution of the 3rd attack. This final stage of the combo comes in two variants – Standard and Empowered, with the latter requiring flash mentioned earlier (which takes around 1.3-1.5 seconds of continuously tapping Basic Attack 3) both of these deal substantial Electric damage and generate more Voltage, especially in its empowered form, which should always be prioritized.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Qingyi can also charge her Basic Attack for a powerful variant by holding it down. The unempowered charge is weak, but the empowered version unleashes a six-part sequence of dashing attacks, ending in a final smash.  It features high damage, Daze multipliers and can access her Core Passive. It can be ended early by releasing the hold, causing her to skip to final smash at the cost of other dash attacks. While executing the final smash, Qingyi becomes Invulnerable and if you can time it just before the enemy strikes, she performs a Perfect Dodge. This empowered sequence is vital for Qingyi’s rotation and should be the focal point of her gameplay.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"To gain access to the empowered variant of her held Basic Attack, Qingyi must first have at least 75 Voltage, after which she’ll consume all of it in order to execute the empowered attack sequence. Any voltage consumed over the minimum 75 required will grant the attack an additional 1% damage and 0.5% Daze for a total possible increase of 25% increased damage and 12.5% increased Daze at 100 voltage. However despite this bonus, it is generally recommended to execute more frequent empowered Basic Attacks instead. As an extra bonus when executing Qingyi empowered Held Basic Attack, Basic Part 3 and Basic Part 4 she gains Anti-Interrupt and 40% Damage Reduction.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Qingyi's standard Special Attack is rarely used, but her EX-Special is pivotal to her playstyle. This ability delivers a powerful Electric strike, generating Voltage and strong Daze, and allows Qingyi to skip directly to the third stage of her Basic Attack combo when immediately followed by tapping the Basic Attack. This interaction forms the backbone of Qingyi's optimal combo sequence:","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"EX-Special Attack: Moonlit Begonia","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Basic Attack: Penultimate P3 (Tap until empowered P4 is available and Voltage is close to 75)","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Basic Attack: Penultimate P4 (Empowered)","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Basic Attack: Enchanted Moonlit Blossoms (Consumes 75 Voltage)","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"This combo unleashes a large amount of Daze and fully utilizes Qingyi’s kit. The EX-Special can be charged by holding it, increasing the energy cost from 60 to 80, allowing for increased damage, Voltage generation and Daze but at the cost of fewer combo opportunities. Whether to use the standard or charged EX depends on the player's preference for frequency versus power.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"A tip for Qingyi’s EX-Special would be that it can miss some of its strikes unless you’re in very close proximity to your target resulting in less Daze, damage and Voltage so stick as close to enemies as possible when using this ability.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Qingyi’s Chain attack and Ultimate both deliver powerful Electric strikes with solid multiplier values. Qingyi’s Chain attack can be used on Bosses for some additional damage and Voltage generation but generally isn’t as useful to use as a supportive or damage focused Chain from the rest of your team on Elite and Normal enemies. While Qingyi’s Ultimate has the bonus of recovering her entire Voltage gauge on use, those decibels are best used elsewhere generally.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Qingyi’s Dash Attack simply executes a forward strike dealing Physical Damage. Qingyi’s Dodge Counter is another powerful skill. It allows her to skip the first two stages of her Basic Attack combo and jump straight into the third, dealing significant Daze and generating Voltage. This ability enables an alternative combo sequence without relying on EX:","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Dodge Counter: Lingering Sentiments","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Basic Attack: Penultimate P3 (Tap until empowered P4 is available and Voltage is close to 75)","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Basic Attack: Penultimate P4 (Empowered)","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Basic Attack: Enchanted Moonlit Blossoms (Consumes 75 Voltage)","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"For a High Voltage & Daze Combo using both EX and Dodge Counter:","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Dodge Counter: Lingering Sentiments","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Basic Attack: Penultimate P3 (Tap only until empowered P4 available)","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Basic Attack: Penultimate P4 (Empowered)","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"EX Special Attack: Moonlit Begonia","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Basic Attack: Enchanted Moonlit Blossoms (Consumes 85 -100 Voltage)","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Qingyi’s Quick Assist and Assist Follow-up don’t do anything special and simply deal Electric damage, Daze and generate some Voltage. These moves generally aren’t used though as Qingyi much prefers to spend all her time on field executing combos or making use of Dodge Counters.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Qingyi's Core Passive revolves around the Subjugation debuff, which increases the Stun damage multiplier on enemies by 4% per stack when their Daze bar is maxed. Subjugation can stack up to 20 times, potentially raising a boss’s stun damage multiplier from 150% to 230% lasting until they recover from Stun.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Qingyi applies Subjugation through her empowered charged Basic Attack, making it essential to her supportive capabilities. Final smash applies 5 Subjugation stacks and 1 additional stack per Dash Attack executed before for a total of 10 stacks. Thus requiring her to execute 2 empowered combos to get full benefit from her Core Passive, however against non-boss enemies, Qingyi applies double Subjugation stacks, allowing her to reach maximum stacks with a single empowered charged Basic Attack.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Additionally, if you end your empowered charged Basic Attack early to take advantage of the Dodge Component of the ability and manage to land it, the final smash will be set to 10 Subjugation stacks regardless of how many Dash Attacks were executed prior.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Wrapping up her kit, Qingyi’s Additional Ability grants her 20% increased Daze to her Basics (which make up a big chunk of her overall Daze capabilities) and 6 Flat Combat Attack for every point of Impact she has over 120 up to a maximum of 600. In endgame gear with an Impact-increasing W-engine (Preferably with a Combat Impact% Bonus) it is possible to max out this bonus consistently,  granting Qingyi a nice bit of bonus damage. What makes this Additional Ability so great though is that all that’s needed to activate it is teaming Qingyi with ANY Combat character or of course a member of her faction.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Qingyi stands out as one of the best Stunning characters in the game at the time of her release, thanks to her large and universal Stun damage amplification and solid Daze output. However, her demanding playstyle requires her to occupy the majority of field time outside the Stun window to maximize her Voltage generation and Subjugation stacks application. While this might not suit every player, Qingyi’s position at the top of the meta is unquestionable, making her a valuable addition to any team focused on Stun mechanics.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Strong Daze output capable of stunning enemies in short order.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Satisfying combo playstyle that after some practice flows smoothly.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Multiple Damage Reductions, Anti-Interrupt buffs and Immunities throughout all of her combos.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Applies a completely Generic and tremendous Damage Amplification during the Stun window allowing burst DPS to reach new heights.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Can effortlessly slot into almost any team thanks to her flexible Additional Ability requirements.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

talents.name: Insulation Breakdown

When using her Basic Attack: Enchanted Moonlit Blossoms, if Flash Connect Voltage is at its maximum, the attack will reduce the defense of the enemy it hits by 15%, and Qingyi's CRIT Rate against that enemy will increase by 20% for 15s.

talents.desc: The Stun DMG Multiplier increase provided by each stack of Subjugation in Core Passive: Eternal Seasons increases to 135% of its original value. When Qingyi's attack hits an enemy and the stacks of Subjugation she applies reaches its maximum stacks, her Daze dealt to the target increases by 15%.

talents.name: Stable Arc Barrier
talents.desc: Upon entering or exiting Flash Connect state, gain a shield equal to 10% of Qingyi's max HP. If a previous shield is still active when the shield effect refreshes, Qingyi generates 5 Energy. This Energy generation effect can be triggered once every 10s.

talents.name: Youthful Spirit
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Eight Meridians
talents.desc: The Interrupt Level of Basic Attack: Enchanted Moonlit Blossoms is greatly increased, and the CRIT DMG is increased by an additional 100%. When Qingyi hits an enemy with her Basic Attack: Enchanted Moonlit Blossoms, the target's Resistance to all Attribute DMG is reduced by 20% for 15s.

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has two pet Bangboo puppets she casts all her abilities with - they hang around on the field after she casts abilities for a short while before returning to her.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has the incredibly generic buff that while Bangboos are on the field Rina grants 25% of her PEN ratio + a flat amount up to a limit of 30% to all team members, increasing the whole team’s damage tremendously.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Additional ability increases all Shock durations from 10 seconds to 13 seconds resulting in higher Shock uptime and 30% more total damage if all Shocks have the chance to run their full duration (essential for Shock teams). Also grants the team 10% Electric damage while there is a Shocked enemy.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Pen Ratio buff is universal enough to always be helpful in any team and the Shock duration extension is unique enough that it’s unlikely Rina will become replaced too quickly.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Very easy to understand and play outside of ensuring Rina’s Bangboo’s stay deployed.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Very high movement speed, ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Dash distance and can attack while slightly moving making Rina one of the highest mobility characters in the game (next to Grace).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

cons.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Many abilities last multiple seconds and occupy Rina’s Bangboos, restricting her from casting another ability until the last one finishes - this makes the use of Rina’s abilities in quick succession challenging.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Bangboos need to be constantly redeployed in order to take advantage of Rina’s Pen Ratio buff, meaning you’ll need to stay on top of weaving her attacking in between your other characters as much as possible.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

review.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Seth is an A-Rank Electric Melee Defense Agent who is just a Support in disguise. He offers strong Anomaly buffs and Shields to both himself and a designated ally.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" Seth contributes significantly to Daze and Anomaly buildup, making him a versatile addition to any team - and what's best, he doesn't need to spend a lot of time on the field to do what he does best!","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Seth's abilities center around a unique resource called Resolve. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"This resource fuels a powerful Enhanced Basic Attack, which triggers a Special Quick Assist for the character positioned before Seth in the squad order - unlike standard Quick Assists, which activate for the next character in line. Seth’s Quick Assist enhances the performance of the preceding squad member - granting them a Shield and a powerful Attribute Anomaly buff for an extended duration. Outside of his Chain Attacks, mastering Seth's kit requires understanding how to maximize this shield and buff for your chosen ally (to be chosen before the mission starts) while keeping Seth’s field time to a minimum.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Seth’s effectiveness hinges on his Core Passive - Protector, and Additional Ability - High Spirit as these are the core of his support capabilities.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Seth’s Core Passive grants Seth a Shield equal to 80% of his initial ATK every time he uses his EX Special Attack, with a maximum cap of 3000 for 25 seconds and a 10-second cooldown. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"The shield’s strength is tied to Seth’s initial ATK, meaning it remains unaffected by any in-combat ATK buffs.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" What you see on his stat page before a mission is what you get in battle. When Seth triggers a Quick Assist via his Charged Hold Basic Attack or Assist Follow-Up, the same Shield, with identical scaling, cap, and duration, is granted to the ally benefiting from the assist. Additionally, all squad members, including Seth, who are shielded by this effect, gain a significant 100 additional Anomaly Proficiency at max rank. However, due to the mechanics of Seth’s Shields, only himself and the preceding squad member in order can benefit from this buff.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Seth’s Additional Ability is simpler.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" It requires at least one squadmate to share Seth’s Attribute or Faction to activate. When active, Seth’s Chain Attack or Charged Hold Basic Attack reduces the enemy's Anomaly Buildup Resistance by 20% for 20 seconds. This debuff significantly enhances Anomaly team performance, increasing overall damage and consistency by accelerating Anomaly application. Since both attacks that apply this effect are commonly used by Seth, maintaining this debuff almost permanently is straightforward and easy.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Seth wields two distinct Basic Attack forms: a standard 4-part combo and a specialized Charged Hold Basic Attack. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"His standard combo is rarely employed","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":", due to its lack of Resolve generation and contribution to team utility, thus we shall bypass its details and instead focus on the Charged Hold Basic Attack, which is far more crucial to Seth's role.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Seth’s Charged Basic Attack: Lightning Strike - Electrified requires and consumes 75% of his Resolve Bar to activate and will cause Seth to launch a flurry of lightning slashes followed by a large finishing move dealing moderate Daze and Electric Anomaly.This attack is irreplaceable for triggering his unique Quick Assist, which applies a shield to an ally, as well as for maintaining the Anomaly Resistance Reduction debuff on enemies. Because of this building and then spending the 75% Resolve to activate it should always be at the top of his priority list and thankfully is easily achievable thanks to his EX Special.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Seth's EX Special Attack is one of his most reliable and efficient methods for accumulating Resolve.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" By consuming 80 energy, Seth releases a barrage of heavy Electric attacks that inflict substantial Daze and Electric Anomaly damage. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"More importantly, this attack immediately grants Seth 75% Resolve","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":", making it an essential component of his rotation. The synergy between the EX Special and his Charged Hold Basic Attack forms his primary combo. This combo should be employed whenever the energy is available, and when either Seth, his designated ally, or the enemy lacks the buffs or debuffs from his Core Passive or Additional Ability.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Seth's EX Special can be further enhanced by holding the EX button - charging the attack at cost of additional time.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":" While this increases the damage, Daze, and Anomaly application, it does not affect Resolve generation","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":". The additional charge time can be significant, but it can be shortened by executing the charge immediately following a Chain Attack, Ultimate, Dodge Counter, Assist Follow-Up, or Quick Assist. Furthermore, Seth can reduce the recovery time of the Charged EX by performing a Dash Cancel after the final strike, or by Swapping to another character while Seth completes the attack. While the Charged EX can provide a slight boost to Seth's damage, Daze, and Anomaly output, it is entirely optional. Skipping the charge in favor of the standard EX Special will not hinder Seth’s supportive capabilities and may even result in gaining extra field time for other characters.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Seth's Chain Attack and Ultimate both deal damage, apply Daze, and Anomaly effects compared to moves of their type for defense characters like Seth, ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"but they also both generate 75% Resolve on use. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"The resolve generation of the chain attack on top of the application/reapplication of Seth’s 20% Anomaly Resistance Reduction make it well worth using whenever you have a Chain Attack to spare. Utilizing Chain Attacks whenever possible, without causing a significant damage loss, reduces the pressure of relying solely on Seth’s EX Special to access his Charged Hold Basic Attack, while also keeping one of his most important supportive bonuses active more consistently. Seth’s Ultimate on the other hand sadly isn’t worth using as between his EX’s and Chain Attacks he more than Resolve he needs covered.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Seth’s Quick Assist is rather unremarkable and rarely used. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"However, the synergy between his Defensive Assist and Assist Follow-Up is where he shines. Using Seth’s Assist Follow-Up similarly to his Enhanced Hold Basic Attack triggers a Quick Assist, which, like the Basic Attack, can grant all of Seth’s Core Passive bonuses to a teammate. This makes it a viable alternative in combat, particularly when Resolve or energy is in short supply.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Overall, Seth emerges as a formidable Anomaly support powerhouse, yet his playstyle is refreshingly straightforward.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" He only requires the execution of one simple combo to effectively apply all his buffs, shields, and debuffs:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Standard Combo ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"EX Special Attack: Thunder Shield Rush - High Voltage (Generates 75% Resolve)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Lightning Strike - Electrified (Consumes 75% Resolve)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Team Mate Quick Assist","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Despite the simplicity of his core combo, Seth boasts an array of tricks, alternative combo sequences, and options to further enhance his performance. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"These elements collectively position him as a top-tier character within the Anomaly archetype, offering both ease of use and depth for those willing to explore his full potential.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Very simple playstyle.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"High duration buff/debuff uptime and they are also easy to apply, which makes keeping them all active easy.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Takes up minimal field time.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Offers decent Defensive shields.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Grants a big Anomaly efficiency bonus to himself and an ally of your choosing.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Debuffs enemies causing them to lose 20% Anomaly Buildup Resistance of all element types.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

cons.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Can only consistently buff himself and 1 other teammate with his shield and Anomaly Efficiency.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Attack animations on most important attacks his EX Special and Charged Held Basic are on the slower side.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

talents.desc: The shield value provided by Shield of Firm Resolve and its maximum limit is increased by 30%. When Shield of Firm Resolve ends, the Anomaly Proficiency increase provided by Core Passive: Protector lasts an additional 10s.

talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.desc: The Daze caused by Defensive Assist: Thundershield is increased by 25%.

talents.name: Distant Admiration

introduction.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Seth, a rookie officer in the Public Security Criminal Investigation Special Response Team, is a key player in providing fire support during criminal investigations. He graduated at the top of his class in the academy and could have landed a higher position, but he chose the tougher path of the Special Response Team. His impressive profile makes him seem like a genius, but he's actually a hard worker who has had his own struggles. There have been times when he practiced the subjects he wasn't good at until he cried.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

review.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Soldier 11 is a S-Rank Melee Fire Combat Agent having a simple but effective combat style, with some room for skillful play. Her kit is easy to understand, to execute and fits right into various combat scenarios and team compositions. While her damage isn’t Meta-Defining, she does just enough to hold her own in endgame content, making her a reasonable choice of investment until you set your eyes on Limited DPS considering she is available from the Standard Banner.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"The entirety of her kit consists of simple direct damage dealing abilities almost exclusively, with the only exception being attacks which feature the presence of her Signature mechanic “Fire Suppression”. Such attacks are subject to a special timing mechanic, which states that when activating the ability in question “at the right moment”, she will use an Enhanced version of the attack instead. The so-called right moment requires you to execute the desired attack input roughly around the ending of the current attack animation without any other inputs beforehand aka no button mashing! To understand and get hang of this timing, we highly recommend messing around with her kit in VR mode.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her damage is balanced, assuming you’ll achieve Fire Suppression on most of her attacks, making pacing your attack input essential. Fortunately, Solder 11 has ways to forcefully use Fire Suppression on many of her attacks, thus even if you are not the best at executing her special timing mechanic, she is still playable at a good level. With that covered, let's discuss rewards Fire Suppression offers and how the rest of her kit plays out!","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her Basic Attack consists of a 4 part combo, which makes up for a bulk of her damage and will be used for the majority of her field time. At baseline, they deal very underwhelming Physical Damage but can be empowered via Fire Suppression. With the right timing, her Basic Attacks gain higher base multipliers, deal Fire Damage and bonus effects from her Core Passive. All this should make it clear that timing your attacks right should be your utmost priority.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her Special Attack isn't worth using whereas her EX Special is very valuable. Her EX Special produces a massive Slash in front and around her, dealing strong Fire Damage to all enemies in radius and grants Soldier 11 a special Charge based buff. This buff grants her guaranteed Fire Suppression for next 8 attacks (regardless if timed correctly or not, buff does not stack) in next 15 seconds. Due to its high Energy costs and strong damage output, this ability is best saved for Stunned Boss enemies or in large AoE situations. Alternatively it can be utilized for generating guaranteed Fire Suppression Charges in a pinch when you are not confident in landing correct timings in a particular combat scenario.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"In a similar vein to her EX Special, her Chain Attack and Ultimate also deal strong Cleave based Fire Damage while granting her identical Fire Suppression Charge buff. As a primary DPS, her Ultimate should be your primary choice of usage unless running an alternative DPS option. If chosen, it is best to use Soldier 11’s Ultimate after the enemy is Stunned, to make use of Stun Damage Multiplier. That said, with the addition of these two methods to generate Fire Suppression Charges, it will be very rare for her to be without them. However those who can avoid relying on these charges, will be able to use all of her strongest moves at most opportune times instead when the enemy is at their most vulnerable, leading to overall higher flexibility and damage.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Soldier 11’s Dodge, Dodge Counter, Dash Attack and Assists are all standard attacks, except Dash Attack can be upgraded via Fire Suppression granting it higher base multipliers, Fire Damage and boost from her Core Passive.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Rounding off her kit, she gains 2 strong Passives from her Core Passives and Additional Ability. As we discussed earlier, her Core Passive grants all attacks enhanced via Fire Suppression (Basic and Dash Attacks) a whopping 70% Damage Increase. This reinforces the importance of having these Charges or executing her attacks with right timing. Meanwhile, her Additional Ability is activated by having another character of the same Attribute or Faction as her in the team, granting her an unconditional 10% Fire Damage and an additional 22.5% Fire Damage when attacking Stunned enemies.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"In conclusion, Soldier 11 presents herself as a strong DPS option having both - reasonably strong burst damage options when aligning her most powerful attacks with enemy Stun windows, as well as dealing decent sustained damage thanks to her constant access to Fire Suppression enhanced attacks. While playing her perfectly offers greater Flexibility, not doing so isn’t punishing, making her a great option to build early and serve you well until you settle on more premium teams.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has a full team of competitive A-Rank options (Ben as Stun and Lucy as Support) with the option to upgrade the team further with the addition of another S-Rank (Koleda) on release.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Only Fire damage dealer on release.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Incredibly simple playstyle once you get the hang of it.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Core Passive and Additional ability are a pile of free damage that doesn’t require you to do anything.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

cons.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"No stand-out features other than good damage output, putting her at risk of power creep from another Fire DPS that does her job better.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic attacks have a special “timed” mechanic, requiring you to pause a short moment in between each attack in order to deal maximum damage. This mechanic can be bypassed through the use of some abilities but should still be mastered to unlock Soldier 11’s full potential which won't be for everyone.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Part of a faction with no other teammates currently on release limiting her synergies to only fire characters.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}
