build.substats: CRIT RATE = CRIT DMG > ATK% > PEN = ATK

talents.name: Rapid Heat
talents.desc: When Soldier 11 enters combat or switches in, if her Energy is less than 40, her Energy is recovered to 80. This effect can trigger once every 50s.

talents.name: Scorching Convergence
talents.desc: When triggering Fire Suppression, Basic Attack, Dash Attack, and Dodge Counter DMG increases by 3%, up to 12 stacks, lasting 15s, with the duration of each stack calculated separately.

talents.name: Elite Soldier
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Indulgent Blaze
talents.desc: If Fire Suppression is triggered during the 1st, 2nd, or 3rd hit of Soldier 11's Basic Attack or a Dash Attack, Anti-Interrupt Level increases and DMG received is reduced by 18% during skill activation. If Fire Suppression is triggered during the 4th hit of her Basic Attack, she becomes invulnerable during skill activation.

talents.name: Perfect Soldier
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Scorching Flow
talents.desc: When Soldier 11 uses her EX Special Attack, Chain Attack, or Ultimate, she gains 8 stacks of Charge (max 8 stacks). When Fire Suppression is triggered, 1 stack of Charge is consumed, causing the current move to ignore 25% of the target's Fire RES.

introduction.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"A model soldier who follows orders and stays loyal to the mission... At least that's what Soldier 11 demands of herself. Weapons don't need emotions, and need only follow orders... At least that's what Soldier 11 tells herself. No matter how strong the enemy, just get fired up and face it head on... At least that's what Soldier 11 does. She's shed her weakness along with her name, leaving only resolve... At least that's what Soldier 11 thinks.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

review.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Soukaku is an A-Rank Melee Ice Support Agent having a versatile kit with focus on self and teamwide damage increase. As a powerful Support unit, while she boosts all types of allies via her buffs, Ice based characters are particularly benefited, allowing her to be run as a good all rounder or very strong specialist.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her kit revolves around generation and usage of “Vortex Stacks” , a resource exclusive to her. These stacks enhance her Signature ability, ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"italic"}],"value":"Fly the Flag (also referred to Special Attack: Rally! In her kit). ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Doing so enhances her personal and teamwide buffing abilities significantly and should be a priority to do so in combat.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Despite being primarily played as a support, she has decent personal damage when built, and can be played as DPS if you can acquire multiple mindscapes for her.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Lets kick off her skill analysis with her most important ability as mentioned above - Fly the Flag. This ability is present all over her kit and can be accessed in myriad of ways but always keeps the same functionality. Upon its execution, Soukaku slams her flag into ground and channels an Ice Storm, giving herself an Attack buff from her Core Passive and immediately triggering a Quick Assist for next teammate. Many of her Passives and attacks interact with this ability and will be covered later in the review, but first here is the list of all ways in which Fly the Flag can be activated:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Press and Hold Special Attack.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Press and Hold Special Attack after EX Special Attack: Fanning Mosquitoes.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Press and Hold Special Attack after Assist Follow-Up: Sweeping Strike.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Automatically cast as a part of Chain Attack: Pudding Slash.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Automatically cast as a part of Ultimate: Jumbo Pudding Slash.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Before Fly the Flag is activated, aim at achieving 3 Vortex Stacks (Only 2 required if activating Fly the Flag with her Chain Attack or Ultimate skill) to trigger both of her Passive Abilities. Her Core Passive is the more powerful of the two and reads as: “When Soukaku uses ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"italic"}],"value":"Fly the Flag","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":", her ATK is increased by 20%, up to a cap of 500. Consuming 3 stacks of Vortex during ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"italic"}],"value":"Fly the Flag","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" doubles this bonus to 1000.” This self buff can be transferred by Soukaku to an ally of choice via a Quick Assist or Chain Attack, offering a tremendous boost in their damage. A point to note, When transferring via Quick Assist, the ally buffed will be the one directly after Soukaku in turn order, whereas with her Chain Attack, simply continuing the Chain with intended character after her will suffice.  ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"italic"}],"value":"Additional Ability, while strong, is much more specialized","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":", increasing Ice Damage by 20% for 22 seconds, consuming 3 Stacks of Vortex Stacks. You will earn this bonus regardless, but it is only relevant for her personal damage unless running an Ice team.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"As discussed, in order to maximize her kits benefits, You must execute 3 Vortex Stack infused Fly the Flags often, thus making it important to build and spend Vortex Stacks efficiently as fast as possible, with that said - Lets dive into her kit!","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her Basic Attacks are divided into two forms, first being a Physical damage variant, and second being her Frosted Banner form - only accessible after 3 Vortex Stacks consumption. While neither is used when playing her as a Support, here are what they do in case you are planning to play her a DPS.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Physical damage variant, features low multipliers and should be never used. Frosted Banner attacks on the other hand feature high damage multipliers but at the price of having limited Charges per Frosted Banner state - 6 attacks, 12 if she has Mindscape 6. Thus, with such high damage multipliers, gaining and maintaining her Frosted Banner state is vital if planning to deal damage with her outside of her basic Support rotation.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her un-enhanced Special Attacks are not worth using, but energy consuming enhanced EX Special Attack is. Her EX Special Attack has two parts: Fanning Mosquitoes and Rally! (being Fly the Flag discussed above). Fanning Mosquitoes launches an Air Current in front of her that deals decent damage and applies Ice Anomaly at cost of 30 Energy per cast. It can be used for a total of 3 times in succession and provides her with Vortex Stack every cast. Additionally, for the duration of attack, she takes 40% reduced damage and increases her Anti-Interrupt level. An interesting point is that regardless of total casts, she will always end this attack with an overhead smash, unless the Special Attack button is held down by the player at the end of combo. This attack is by far the best way to generate Vortex Stacks for her, depending on your playstyle for Soukaku, you will want to execute at least 2-3 uses of this skill. If desired, she can also cast the Fanning part of her Special Attack, before enemies have spawned in Shiyu Defense mode to save time required to build Vortex Stacks in the middle of combat for first Fly the Flag usage.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her Assists are similar to other Melee Agents, providing decent Daze, damage and Anomaly application. However, her Assist Follow-Ups can trigger Fly the Flag, making it a valuable tool to prevent buff downtime and reduce reliance on long EX Special Attack sequences, Chain Attacks or using her Ultimate.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her Ultimate deals some damage and increases her Critical Hit Rate but generally isn’t used when run as Support with other DPS, limiting its usage to when Soukaku is played as main DPS, where it can be quite strong.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her Chain Attack, deals moderate damage, Daze and also generates Vortex Stack, something only her EX Special Attack and Ultimate do at baseline usually. This means as long as she can gather 2 Vortex Stacks, she can gain the third via Chain Attack to trigger full power Fly the Flag alongside all her buffs, making it one of most effective methods to provide the 1000 Attack boost to her teammates. With this in mind, the most common combo used when playing Soukaku as Support is:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"EX Special Attack: Cooling Bento (Generates 1 Vortex Stack).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"EX Special Attack: Cooling Bento (Generates 1 Vortex Stack).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Chain Attack: Pudding Slash (Generates 1 Vortex Stack and then immediately consumes all 3)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Team Mate Quick Assist.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"When executing the combo above, it is best to briefly remain on field to execute two EX Special Attacks, before Swapping to other teammates until Soukaku’s Chain Attack is ready.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Soukaku thrives in both Ice-based teams as well as general compositions thanks to her universal Attack buff. Her gameplay primarily revolves around managing Vortex Stacks and maximizing her Fly the Flag ability. Understanding her rotations, timing her EX Special Attacks and making full use of her Quick Assists is key to mastering Soukaku. As such, whether as a Support or a DPS, she offers exceptional utility that elevates overall performance of her team significantly when played correctly. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Gains a buff that grants herself an absurd 1000 flat Attack that can be transferred to the next character that switches in after using Fly the Flag normally or as a part of a chain skill. Transferring this ATK buff to your main damage dealer makes Soukaku one of the most potent supports in the game for this alone.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Grants the team 20% additional Ice damage after consuming a full set of 3 Vortex charges - something that can be done easily and continually after a short ramp-up time at the start of the fight.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"All buffs Soukaku applies last a long time meaning they can be maintained indefinitely if managed carefully.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Deals a strong amount of Ice anomaly with most of the attacks she uses when played as a dedicated Support, allowing her to help Freeze and Shatter enemies interrupting their movement and sometimes extending stun durations.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Despite having an Ice-themed additional ability can still be used to support non-Ice damaging characters thanks to her incredibly powerful 1000 possible flat Attack buff.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

cons.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Requires a high amount of personal Attack in order to gain and grant her most powerful 1000 flat Attack buff to herself or allies.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"When activating Fly the Flag to gain her flat Attack buff Soukaku is only capable of gaining the full 1000 potential flat ATK if she consumes 3 Vortex charges which must first be built by using her EX. Casting Fly the Flag without consuming Vortex Charges will only grant 500 flat ATK.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"EX ability feels sluggish to use, opening up Soukaku to getting attacked while using it. While this is a problem it can be mitigated by immediately switching after using the EX.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"EX does not grant a quick assist to the next character like most other support characters. Instead, Soukaku’s quick assist is tied to her Fly the Flag ability which is accessed by holding down the Special Attack regardless if she has enough energy or not.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

talents.name: Uplifting Current
talents.desc: When Soukaku triggers Core Passive: Blade Banner or Additional Ability: Group Set Meal, the buff duration is increased by 8s.

talents.name: Experimental Charging Module
talents.desc: When Soukaku's Basic Attacks, Dash Attacks, Dodge Counters, or Quick Assist hits an enemy, there's a 15% chance she gains 1 stack of Vortex, triggering up to once per second. When Vortex reaches max stacks, any additional stacks grant Soukaku 1.2 Energy instead.

talents.name: Attendance Meal Allowance
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Hypothermia
talents.desc: If an enemy is hit by Fly the Flag, the target's Ice RES is reduced by 10% for 8s.

talents.name: Late-Night Snacks
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Northern Wind
talents.desc: While in the Frosted Banner state, the number of usable enhanced Basic Attacks and enhanced Dash Attacks is increased to 12, and also deal 45% more DMG.

review.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Yanagi is an S-Rank Melee Electric Anomaly Agent who serves as a main field Anomaly DPS and specializes in dealing and amplifying Disorder damage. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Traditionally, Disorder first requires you to have an Anomaly on an enemy and then trigger another one of a different type to activate. However, what makes Yanagi unique is her ability to completely bend these rules with her special mechanic “Polarity Disorder” which she can access via her Ultimate or EX-Special Attack.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":" Polarity Disorder allows Yanagi to trigger a “mini” Disorder on demand ignoring enemies Anomaly build-up and also whether current Anomaly on the enemy is different from Yanagi’s own","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" (Yanagi being an Electric Agent can trigger Polarity Disorder on Shock). This singular part of her kit alone carves out a place for her in the endgame meta as one of the strongest Anomaly DPS in the game, but of course that’s far from all she has to offer.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her playstyle is straightforward but challenging to master, as it features multiple buffs to keep active, many different combos, and when played in Disorder teams a lot of Character-Swaps and Anomaly management.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Outside of Polarity Disorder, the other mechanic that makes her stand out is a special stance mechanic. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Yanagi has two stances, “Jougen” Stance and “Kagen” Stance which she can freely swap between. Each stance changes her Basic Attack pattern and grants her a buff while active. Stances can be swapped through the use of a Special Attack or EX-Special Attack and doing so will allow Yanagi to retain the buff from her previous stance for 8 seconds on top of gaining the buff of the stance she just entered.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":" Getting both buffs at once is a great incentive for swapping between stances already, but the benefits don’t end there.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" Swapping between stances also allows her to execute combos faster and activate her must-use Additional Ability “Gesso”. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"With all that said, the game plan is: to Swap Stances, execute shortened combos, maintain all buffs, use EX Special’s and Ultimates to trigger Polarity Disorder and manage team Anomaly to trigger standard Disorders as you would in any normal Anomaly team. Sounds pretty easy right? Not so much… ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Well fortunately it’s not quite as complicated as it sounds so let's dive into the nitty gritty of her kit to break it down.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Yanagi’s Basic attacks are at the heart of most of her combos and as we’ve learned she has two different sets - one for each of the stances. Which stance you’re currently in and which buffs you have active can be tracked in the top left of the screen (If both sides are lit up you have both buffs!).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Each set of Basic Attacks consists of a 5-part combo including 2 Physical Attacks (Basic 1 and 2) and 3 Electric Attacks (Basic 3, 4 and 5). Both stance combos take roughly the same amount of time to execute, but there are some slight differences regardless, excluding the buffs you gain in each stance. Here is what to look out for:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Jougen Stance:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Full Basic Attack combo does slightly more damage and Anomaly build-up.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Grants Anti-Interrupt Level during Basic Attacks.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"10% increased Electric DMG in stance and for 8 seconds after leaving.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Kagen Stance:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Full Basic Attack combo does slightly less damage and Anomaly build-up.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Grants Interrupt Level Increase against enemies.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"10% increased PEN Ratio% in stance and leaving.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"For those looking to min-max, spending more time in “Jougen” Stance over “Kagen” Stance offers a slight edge,","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" however the main priority should be always keeping both stance buffs active first and foremost instead.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"With min-maxing in mind, Basic Attacks 1 and 2 in both combos being Physical Attacks are not ideal to use as they don’t apply Electric Anomaly build-up. Fortunately, a large majority of her abilities all feature a condition that using Basic Attacks immediately after them allows her to skip both completely and execute Basic Attacks 3,4 and 5 immediately instead. Here’s the list of abilities that allows the streamlining of both Basic Attack combos:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Dodge Counter: Rapid Retaliation","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Chain Attack: Celestial Harmony","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Ultimate: Raiei Tenge","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Special Attack: Ruten","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"EX-Special Attack: Gekka Ruten","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Quick Assist: Blade of Elegance","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Assist Follow-Up: Weeping Willow Stab","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"As can be seen above there are a lot of ways to perform the Basic Attack skip and you should prioritize ensuring you always do it to maximize damage. Here is an example of a common attack sequence:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Dodge Counter: Rapid Retaliation","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Tsukuyomi Kagura: Kagen P3","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Tsukuyomi Kagura: Kagen P4","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Tsukuyomi Kagura: Kagen P5","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Now that we know most of her combos and how stances work, swapping stances and dealing massive damage via Polarity Disorder is next and both are associated with her Special Attacks.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Unlike most characters, Yanagi's standard Special Attack is actually incredibly useful. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Not only using it allows her to immediately Swap-Stance at any time but if it was used following either Basic Attack 3, 4 or 5 of standard combo, she’ll Swap-Stance faster, can continue her streak in her newly entered stance and also gain a small animation speed boost, here’s how it can be used to continually a combo endlessly:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Tsukuyomi Kagura: Kagen juggle back and forth between stances is a surefire way to keep her most powerful attacks flowing freely and all buffs active.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"With enough Energy (40) pressing and holding the Special Attack will activate her EX-Special Attack: Gekka Ruten causing her to perform a two-part attack consisting of a Thrusting Dash and Downward Smash dealing tremendous Anomaly build-up and most importantly, triggering Polarity Disorder. Polarity disorder occurs the moment the smash lands and it behaves similarly to a standard Disorder but instead only deals 15% of the usual damage.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":" However, it has another special base damage multiplier added to it - equalling to 3200% of Yanagi’s Attribute Proficiency (at max rank). ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"The mix of these multipliers ensures decently damaging hits but also has the upside of triggering huge Disorders through Burn, Shock, and Corruption Anomalies when played right. As a difference from the norm and as an added bonus - Polarity Disorder ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"will not","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" remove the Anomaly from the enemy. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"In addition to Polarity Disorder, using her EX-Special Attack also grants her the “Shinrabanshou state” for 15 seconds. While in the “Shinrabanshou state” whenever Yanagi uses Basic Attack 5 she’ll immediately be able to execute Basic Attack 3 right after without any assistance. You’ll have this buff up a good amount of combat making her optimal Basic Attack combo just that much more consistent.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Similar to her standard Special Attack Yanagi’s EX also changes her stance on use but unlike the standard one, this allows her to move straight into Basic Attack 3 regardless of what came before it making it a good tool to start your Basic Attack combo if no other abilities with the signature effect are available. With enough energy available combos like the following are possible:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"EX Special Attack: Gekka Ruten (Enter Shinrabanshou state)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Tsukuyomi Kagura: Jougen P3","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Tsukuyomi Kagura: Jougen P4","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Tsukuyomi Kagura: Jougen P5","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Tsukuyomi Kagura: Jougen P3","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Tsukuyomi Kagura: Jougen P4","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Tsukuyomi Kagura: Jougen P5","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"The other ability that can trigger Polarity Disorder is her Ultimate, which does damage at the same rate of 15% of Disorder and 3200% of Attribute Proficiency -  making it worth using if you can spare the team's Decibels, but not mission critical for her gameplan. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Outside of triggering Polarity Disorder her Ultimate is very standard, primarily offering a tremendous amount of Electric Anomaly.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"The rest of Yanagi’s kit including her Dodge Counter, Chain Attack, Quick Assist and Assist Follow-Up are all simple direct damage strikes that apply a strong amount of Anomaly Build-Up but lack any special effect outside of skipping Basic Attack 1 and 2. All are worth using if the situation arises but none are core to her rotation or gameplan; use them at your discretion as they’re available.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Rounding off her kit is her Core Passive: Lunar Eclipse, which increases the base multiplier of Disorder damage from 450% to 700% (at max rank) for the whole squad for 15 seconds when using her EX-Special attack. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"How impactful this bonus will be depends on the Anomaly Disorder you’re triggering, but it’s always worth keeping active. As an added benefit after striking an enemy with her EX she also increases the Electric Damage% against them by 20% for 15 seconds doubling up on the buff value.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Lastly,","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":" her Additional ability grants her a 45% Electric Anomaly build-up increase on the first Basic Attack she does following a stance change lasting for 8 seconds.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" This buff timing lines up perfectly with the lingering benefits of each stance making maintaining it no extra effort for what is ultimately a huge boost.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"To conclude, ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Yanagi cheats the system by being able to access Disorder at any time with no strings attached regardless of team composition","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":", can infinitely string together high Anomaly Basic Attack combos making for excellent sustained damage regardless of resources, can amplify her own (and the team) Disorder multipliers and has incredible burst on demand if you’re willing to pull out all the stops. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"At the time of her release Yanagi is absolutely one of the best DPS in the game,","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" able to stand alone with Supports or alongside another Anomaly powerhouse of your choosing. While she’s combo-heavy, a bit challenging to play, and wants a good amount of field time to facilitate her Basic Attack sequences and Stance-Swaps, the payoff is well worth the investment if your team can work alongside her.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Can trigger Disorder on demand regardless of Anomaly Buildup.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Can play Disorder in a team completely consisting of her own element (Electric) opening up additional strong team-building possibilities.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has excellent burst and sustained Anomaly application ideal as a main fielder and in disorder teams.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Boosts the team's Disorder damage multipliers.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

build.substats: Anomaly Proficiency > ATK% > PEN = ATK

talents.name: Know Thy Self, Know Thy Enemy
talents.desc: When any squad member inflicts an Anomaly on an enemy, Yanagi gains 1 stack of Clarity, lasting 15s, stacking up to 3 times. Repeated triggers reset the duration. Upon being hit by an enemy attack, Yanagi consumes 1 stack of Clarity to gain invulnerability for 1s. When Yanagi has 1 or more stacks of Clarity, her Anomaly Proficiency increases by 80.

talents.name: Outstanding Adaptability
talents.desc: During her EX Special Attack, the rapid thrust's Electric Anomaly Buildup increases by 20%. Holding down the Special Attack button after a rapid thrust hits an enemy will consume 10 additional Energy to launch another thrust. If Energy is insufficient or the button is released, the attack automatically follows up with the downward attack. When the downward attack hits an enemy suffering an Anomaly and triggers Polarity Disorder, the DMG multiplier increases to 20% of the original Disorder effect. Each additional thrust increases this multiplier by 15%, up to a maximum of 2 extra thrusts.

talents.name: Tsukishiro Style Management
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Chessmaster
talents.desc: When Yanagi inflicts Attribute Anomaly DMG on an enemy, they suffer the Exposed effect, lasting 15s. Attacks on enemies under the Expose effect will have 16% increased PEN Ratio.

talents.name: Other Mother
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Inhuman Blood
talents.desc: After a thrust attack during her EX Special Attack, the duration of the Shinrabanshou state increases to 30s. While the state is active and her EX Special Attack DMG increases by 20%. The maximum number of times the additional DMG multiplier increase effect for Polarity Disorder in Outstanding Adaptability can be triggered increases to 4, and the Energy cost for the first 4 additional thrust attacks is halved.

review.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Zhu Yuan is a Ranged/Melee hybrid S-Rank Ether Combat Agent specializing in delivering massive Ether Burst damage to stunned enemies with her unique ammunition system","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":". With her high mobility, Zhu Yuan integrates multiple Dash attacks into her optimal damage combos, allowing her to reposition mid-attack and implement Invulnerability frames while dealing optimal damage.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Zhu Yuan’s kit revolves around her Shotgun Shell gauge, which can hold up to 9 Enhanced Shells. These shells empower her Basic and Dash Attacks. She switches between two modes of attack: Assault Mode and Suppressive Mode.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Assault Mode","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":": This mode includes most of her Default Attack sequences. It deals low damage but focuses on generating Enhanced Shotgun Shells.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Suppressive Mode","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":": This mode features high-damage Charged Attacks. It can be accessed by holding down the basic attack, causing Zhu Yuan to perform a backflip before entering Suppressive Mode. In this mode, while holding, Zhu Yuan continuously consumes 1-3 Enhanced Shotgun Shells to deal massive damage with her attacks.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Zhu Yuan has some of the most varied combos available in the game, with each offering unique benefits in different situations. Learning and mastering them all is quite a challenge. Fortunately, it’s possible to focus on the most commonly used, highest-damage combos, which this guide will cover. Zhu Yuan has access to two completely different basic attack combos, one for each Suppressive and Assault mode.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Zhu Yuan’s Assault Mode Basic Attacks consist of a six-part attack combo (despite the game only listing five of the six parts). Here is the breakdown of the combo:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Assault Mode Basic P1: Physical Melee Kick","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Assault Mode Basic P2: Ether Ranged Shotgun Blast","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Assault Mode Basic P3: Physical Melee Multi-Kick","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Assault Mode Basic P4: Ether Ranged Shotgun Jump Blast (Generates 1 Shell)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Assault Mode Basic P5: Ether Ranged Shotgun Dash Blast (Generates 1 Shell)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Assault Mode Basic P6: Ether Ranged Shotgun Slide","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"The most valuable attacks in this sequence are Basic P4 and P5, as they deal the best damage and also generate Zhu Yuan's shells. Ideally, we’d like to access these as frequently as possible.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Another unique aspect of Zhu Yuan’s basic attacks is that she can weave in a Dash Attack after any of the combo sequences above by triggering a Basic Attack by holding down the directional key. In this guide, we’ll be talking specifically about her left and right Dash Attacks (they’re the same as each other), as they are the most effective in her kit and the ones you should be using whenever mentioned. Dashing after attacks in this way will alter the sequencing of her next attack depending on which you dashed after. Here is a list of how using a side dash after each part of the Assault Mode basic attack changes things:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Assault Mode Basic P1 -> Dash Attack -> Assault Mode Basic P3 (Optimal)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Assault Mode Basic P2 -> Dash Attack -> Assault Mode Basic P3 (Avoid)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Assault Mode Basic P3 -> Dash Attack -> Loop Back to Assault Mode Basic P3 (Avoid)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Assault Mode Basic P4 -> Dash Attack -> Assault Mode Basic P5 (Avoid)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Assault Mode Basic P5 -> Dash Attack -> Loop to Assault Mode Basic P3 (Optimal)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Assault Mode Basic P6 -> Dash Attack -> Loop Back to Assault Mode Basic P3 (Avoid)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"The changes to attack ordering allow Zhu Yuan to execute higher damage, faster combos that generate more shells. Yuan’s standard rotation and loop/skip to the best parts of it.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Zhu Yuan’s other Basic Attack moves are within Suppressive Mode, which, as mentioned above, needs to be entered by holding down the Basic Attack and waiting for Zhu Yuan to perform a short preparatory flip. The time needed for Zhu Yuan to enter Suppressive Mode is roughly 0.5 seconds, long enough that you don’t want to be constantly moving in and out of Assault and Suppressive unless necessary. The best approach is to enter Suppressive mode only when you have sufficient Enhanced Shells to consume (5 or 9 being optimal). Additionally, several abilities in Zhu Yuan’s kit allow her to immediately enter Suppressive Mode without delay as long as you immediately begin using Suppressive Mode Basics right after they finish. These abilities are:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"EX Special Attack","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Ultimate Attack","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Chain Attack","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"After entering Suppression mode, continuously holding down the Basic Attack will cause Zhu Yuan to fire an Enhanced Shotgun combo consisting of 3 parts which if available, will each consume a number of Shotgun Shells to deal either tiny Physical (un-enhanced) or massive Ether damage (enhanced). Due to the poor multipliers on Zhu Yuan’s un-enhanced Suppressive Basics it’s never worth using them without Shells available. Here is how many Shells each attack uses:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Suppressive Mode Basic P1 = 1 Shell","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Suppressive Mode Basic P2 = 1 Shell","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Suppressive Mode Basic P3 = 3 Shells (Deals triple the damage of P1 and P2)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Just like Zhu Yuan’s Assault Mode Basic Attacks, she can also make use of a special Suppressive Mode Dodge Attack to alter and improve her Basic Attack sequences. We’ll again be making use of side Dash Attacks (left and right) as they are the most competitive in most cases. Here is how dashes affect the combo:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Suppressive Mode Basic P1 -> Suppressive Mode Dash Attack -> Suppressive Mode Basic P3","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Suppressive Mode Basic P2 -> Suppressive Mode Dash Attack -> Suppressive Mode Basic P3","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Suppressive Mode Basic P3 -> Suppressive Mode Dash Attack -> Suppressive Mode Basic P3 (Loop)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"The key takeaway here is that we can use a Suppressive Mode Dash Attack following a Suppressive Mode Basic P3 to skip straight back to another P3 incredibly quickly, allowing us to consume our Shells much faster and increase Zhu Yuan’s burst potential. Here is an example combo that dumps all 9 Shells as fast as possible (a full gauge):","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Suppressive Mode Basic P1 (1 Shell)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Suppressive Mode Basic P2 (1 Shell)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Suppressive Mode Basic P3 (3 Shells) ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Suppressive Mode Dash Attack (1 Shell)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Suppressive Mode Basic P3  (3 Shells)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"As mentioned above, Zhu Yuan has a Dash Attack for both Assault Mode and Suppressive Mode. For both modes, she has different Dash attacks for forward, back, left and right, but left and right are primarily used in both modes for her combos. They can be not only used mid-combo for cancels but also in general combat outside of combos.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Zhu Yuan’s Dodge Counter is a quick Shotgun Blast that deals Ether damage and generates 1 Shotgun Shell, making it an optimal way to stack up Shells quickly against fast-attacking enemies. Following this Dodge Counter, Zhu Yuan skips straight to her Assault Mode Basic P3, allowing her to quickly chain attacks together if desired.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Zhu Yuan’s Quick Assist and Assist Follow-Up both launch a Shotgun Blast dealing Ether damage and generating Shotgun Shells. Her Quick Assist generates 1 Shell and her Assist Follow-Up generates 3.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Zhu Yuan’s EX Special Attack, Chain Attack, and Ultimate are all functionally the same but with varying damage multipliers. All of them trigger massive Shotgun Blasts that immediately place Zhu Yuan in Suppressive Mode allowing for immediate usage of Suppressive Mode Basics and generating 3 Shells each.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"To round off her kit, Zhu Yuan features an incredible Core Passive as well as an Additional Ability, both of which tremendously boost her damage output. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Zhu Yuan’s Core Passive boosts the damage of all her Shell-Enhanced Suppressive Mode Basic Attacks and Dash Attacks by up to 40%, further increasing against Stunned targets by another 40% for a total of 80%. She also gains 6 Shells at the start of each combat. Meanwhile, with her Additional Ability if Zhu Yuan has a Support character or a character sharing either her Faction in the team, she’ll gain 30% Crit Rate for 10 seconds after using an EX Special, Chain, or Ultimate. This buff is all but guaranteed to be permanently active during Zhu Yuan’s main burst window where she unloads all her Shells (usually against Stunned enemies). ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Zhu Yuan’s build-and-spend kit plays perfectly into a Burst damage playstyle where she can build up Shells, Energy, and her Ultimate to unleash strong attacks on Stunned enemies in an incredibly short amount of time. At the time of her release, Zhu Yuan delivers the most Burst damage during a Stun window in the game, assuming she has all her kit at her disposal.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Zhu Yuan is the new highest Burst DPS during Stun windows.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"She has a strong F2P-friendly support in Nicole.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Zhu Yuan possesses exceptional mobility options that not only do not lower her damage but actually increase it, allowing her to reposition on the battlefield constantly and effectively.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Due to baked-in dash attacks in most of her attack sequences, Zhu Yuan gains small moments of invulnerability mid-combo, providing her with an edge in combat survivability.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"At the time of her release, Zhu Yuan is the only Ether DPS, giving her a unique niche in the game.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Good cleave-based hitboxes on almost all attacks for a character that is mostly ranged DPS.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

build.substats: CRIT RATE = CRIT DMG > ATK% > PEN = ATK

talents.name: Quick Reload
talents.desc: When Zhu Yuan activates Chain Attacks/Ultimates, gain the Quick Reload effect. When Zhu Yuan has the Quick Reload effect and uses up all Enhanced Shotshells, the Quick Reload effect will be consumed to instantly gain 6/9 Enhanced Shotshells.

talents.name: Ether Ember
talents.desc: In Suppressive Mode, Zhu Yuan’s Anti-Interrupt level is increased and DMG taken reduced by 10%. When Zhu Yuan hits an enemy with Enhanced Shotshells, the target takes 10% more Ether DMG from Basic Attack: Please Do Not Resist and Dash Attack: Overwhelming Firepower DMG, stacking up to 5 times and lasting for 5s. Each shot adds one stack of this effect, and repeated triggers reset the duration.

talents.name: Public Security Special Training
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Ether Perforation
talents.desc: When Zhu Yuan hits an enemy with Enhanced Shotshells, her Basic Attack: Please Do Not Resist and Dash Attack: Overwhelming Firepower ignore 25% of the target’s Ether RES.

talents.name: Special Ops Experience
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Expanded Energy Pack III
talents.desc: When Zhu Yuan consumes a total of 12 Enhanced Shotshells, she receives the Ether Afterglow effect, and the Energy cost of the next EX Special Attack is reduced by 30. Launching an EX Special Attack will consume Ether Afterglow and shoot an additional 4-bullet Ether Buckshot. Each extra bullet deals DMG equal to 220% of Zhu Yuan's ATK.
